EU O
rejects O
German O
call O
to O
boycott O
British O
lamb O
. O

Peter B-PERSON
Blackburn E-PERSON

BRUSSELS O
1996-08-22 O

The O
European O
Commission O
said O
on O
Thursday O
it O
disagreed O
with O
German O
advice O
to O
consumers O
to O
shun O
British O
lamb O
until O
scientists O
determine O
whether O
mad O
cow O
disease O
can O
be O
transmitted O
to O
sheep O
. O

Germany O
's O
representative O
to O
the O
European O
Union O
's O
veterinary O
committee O
Werner B-PERSON
Zwingmann E-PERSON
said O
on O
Wednesday O
consumers O
should O
buy O
sheepmeat O
from O
countries O
other O
than O
Britain O
until O
the O
scientific O
advice O
was O
clearer O
. O

" O
We O
do O
n't O
support O
any O
such O
recommendation O
because O
we O
do O
n't O
see O
any O
grounds O
for O
it O
, O
" O
the O
Commission O
's O
chief O
spokesman O
Nikolaus B-PERSON
van I-PERSON
der I-PERSON
Pas E-PERSON
told O
a O
news O
briefing O
. O

He O
said O
further O
scientific O
study O
was O
required O
and O
if O
it O
was O
found O
that O
action O
was O
needed O
it O
should O
be O
taken O
by O
the O
European O
Union O
. O

He O
said O
a O
proposal O
last O
month O
by O
EU O
Farm O
Commissioner O
Franz B-PERSON
Fischler E-PERSON
to O
ban O
sheep O
brains O
, O
spleens O
and O
spinal O
cords O
from O
the O
human O
and O
animal O
food O
chains O
was O
a O
highly O
specific O
and O
precautionary O
move O
to O
protect O
human O
health O
. O

Fischler S-PERSON
proposed O
EU-wide O
measures O
after O
reports O
from O
Britain O
and O
France O
that O
under O
laboratory O
conditions O
sheep O
could O
contract O
Bovine O
Spongiform O
Encephalopathy O
( O
BSE O
) O
-- O
mad O
cow O
disease O
. O

But O
Fischler S-PERSON
agreed O
to O
review O
his O
proposal O
after O
the O
EU O
's O
standing O
veterinary O
committee O
, O
mational O
animal O
health O
officials O
, O
questioned O
if O
such O
action O
was O
justified O
as O
there O
was O
only O
a O
slight O
risk O
to O
human O
health O
. O

Spanish O
Farm O
Minister O
Loyola B-PERSON
de I-PERSON
Palacio E-PERSON
had O
earlier O
accused O
Fischler S-PERSON
at O
an O
EU O
farm O
ministers O
' O
meeting O
of O
causing O
unjustified O
alarm O
through O
" O
dangerous O
generalisation O
. O
" O

. O

Only O
France O
and O
Britain O
backed O
Fischler S-PERSON
's O
proposal O
. O

The O
EU O
's O
scientific O
veterinary O
and O
multidisciplinary O
committees O
are O
due O
to O
re-examine O
the O
issue O
early O
next O
month O
and O
make O
recommendations O
to O
the O
senior O
veterinary O
officials O
. O

Sheep O
have O
long O
been O
known O
to O
contract O
scrapie O
, O
a O
brain-wasting O
disease O
similar O
to O
BSE O
which O
is O
believed O
to O
have O
been O
transferred O
to O
cattle O
through O
feed O
containing O
animal O
waste O
. O

British O
farmers O
denied O
on O
Thursday O
there O
was O
any O
danger O
to O
human O
health O
from O
their O
sheep O
, O
but O
expressed O
concern O
that O
German O
government O
advice O
to O
consumers O
to O
avoid O
British O
lamb O
might O
influence O
consumers O
across O
Europe O
. O

" O
What O
we O
have O
to O
be O
extremely O
careful O
of O
is O
how O
other O
countries O
are O
going O
to O
take O
Germany O
's O
lead O
, O
" O
Welsh O
National O
Farmers O
' O
Union O
( O
NFU O
) O
chairman O
John B-PERSON
Lloyd I-PERSON
Jones E-PERSON
said O
on O
BBC O
radio O
. O

Bonn O
has O
led O
efforts O
to O
protect O
public O
health O
after O
consumer O
confidence O
collapsed O
in O
March O
after O
a O
British O
report O
suggested O
humans O
could O
contract O
an O
illness O
similar O
to O
mad O
cow O
disease O
by O
eating O
contaminated O
beef O
. O

Germany O
imported O
47,600 O
sheep O
from O
Britain O
last O
year O
, O
nearly O
half O
of O
total O
imports O
. O

It O

of O

, O

overall O

. O

FRANKFURT O
1996-08-22 O

German O
first-time O
registrations O
of O
motor O
vehicles O
jumped O
14.2 O
percent O
in O
July O
this O
year O
from O
the O
year-earlier O
period O
, O
the O
Federal O
office O
for O
motor O
vehicles O
said O
on O
Thursday O
. O

The O
office O
said O
356,725 O
new O
cars O
were O
registered O
in O
July O
1996 O
-- O
304,850 O
passenger O
cars O
and O
15,613 O
trucks O
. O

The O
figures O
represent O
a O
13.6 O
percent O
increase O
for O
passenger O
cars O
and O
a O
2.2 O
percent O
decline O
for O
trucks O
from O
July O
1995 O
. O

Motor-bike O
registration O
rose O
32.7 O
percent O
in O
the O
period O
. O

The O
growth O
was O
partly O
due O
to O
an O
increased O
number O
of O
Germans O
buying O
German O
cars O
abroad O
, O
while O
manufacturers O
said O
that O
domestic O
demand O
was O
weak O
, O
the O
federal O
office O
said O
. O

Almost O
all O
German O
car O
manufacturers O
posted O
gains O
in O
registration O
numbers O
in O
the O
period O
. O

Volkswagen O
AG O
won O
77,719 O
registrations O
, O
slightly O
more O
than O
a O
quarter O
of O
the O
total O
. O

Opel O
AG O
together O
with O
General O
Motors O
came O
in O
second O
place O
with O
49,269 O
registrations O
, O
16.4 O
percent O
of O
the O
overall O
figure O
. O

Third O
was O
Ford O
with O
35,563 O
registrations O
, O
or O
11.7 O
percent O
. O

Only O
Seat O
and O
Porsche O
had O
fewer O
registrations O
in O
July O
1996 O
compared O
to O
last O
year O
's O
July O
. O

Seat O
posted O
3,420 O
registrations O
compared O
with O
5522 O
registrations O
in O
July O
a O
year O
earlier O
. O

Porsche O
's O
registrations O
fell O
to O
554 O
from O
643 O
. O

Israel O
plays O
down O
fears O
of O
war O
with O
Syria O
. O

Colleen B-PERSON
Siegel E-PERSON

JERUSALEM O
1996-08-22 O

Israel O
's O
outgoing O
peace O
negotiator O
with O
Syria O
said O
on O
Thursday O
current O
tensions O
between O
the O
two O
countries O
appeared O
to O
be O
a O
storm O
in O
a O
teacup O
. O

Itamar B-PERSON
Rabinovich E-PERSON
, O
who O
as O
Israel O
's O
ambassador O
to O
Washington O
conducted O
unfruitful O
negotiations O
with O
Syria O
, O
told O
Israel O
Radio O
it O
looked O
like O
Damascus O
wanted O
to O
talk O
rather O
than O
fight O
. O

" O
It O
appears O
to O
me O
the O
Syrian O
priority O
is O
still O
to O
negotiate O
. O

The O
Syrians O
are O

, O
they O
are O
definitely O

, O
but O
the O
general O
assessment O
here O
in O
Washington O
is O
that O
this O
is O

a O

in O

, O
" O
he O
said O
. O

Rabinovich S-PERSON
is O
winding O
up O
his O
term O
as O
ambassador O
. O

He O
will O
be O
replaced O
by O
Eliahu B-PERSON
Ben-Elissar E-PERSON
, O
a O
former O
Israeli O
envoy O
to O
Egypt O
and O
right-wing O
Likud O
party O
politician O
. O

Israel O
on O
Wednesday O
sent O
Syria O
a O
message O
, O
via O
Washington O
, O
saying O
it O
was O
committed O
to O
peace O
and O
wanted O
to O
open O
negotiations O
without O
preconditions O
. O

But O
it O
slammed O
Damascus O
for O
creating O
what O
it O
called O
a O
dangerous O
atmosphere O
. O

Syria O
accused O
Israel O
on O
Wednesday O
of O
launching O
a O
hysterical O
campaign O
against O
it O
after O
Israeli O
television O
reported O
that O
Damascus O
had O
recently O
test O
fired O
a O

. O

It O
said O

lower O
, O

said O
. O

to O

and O

support O
. O

German O
farm O
ministry O
tells O
consumers O
to O
avoid O
British O
mutton O
. O

BONN O
1996-08-22 O

Germany O
's O
Agriculture O
Ministry O
suggested O
on O
Wednesday O
that O
consumers O
avoid O
eating O
meat O
from O
British O
sheep O
until O
scientists O
determine O
whether O
mad O
cow O
disease O
can O
be O
transmitted O
to O
the O
animals O
. O

" O
Until O
this O
is O
cleared O
up O
by O
the O
European O
Union O
's O
scientific O
panels O
-- O
and O
we O
have O
asked O
this O
to O
be O
done O
as O
quickly O
as O
possible O
-- O
( O
consumers O
) O
should O
if O
at O
all O
possible O
give O
preference O
to O
sheepmeat O
from O
other O
countries O
, O
" O
ministry O
official O
Werner B-PERSON
Zwingmann E-PERSON
told O
ZDF O
television O
. O

" O
I O
do O
not O
want O
to O
say O
that O
there O
is O
a O
concrete O
danger O
for O
consumers O
, O
" O
he O
added O
. O
" O

There O
are O
too O
many O
holes O
in O
what O
we O
know O
, O
and O
these O
must O
be O
filled O
very O
quickly O
. O
" O

Bonn O
has O
led O
efforts O
to O
ensure O
consumer O
protection O
tops O
the O
list O
of O
priorities O
in O
dealing O
with O
the O
mad O
cow O
crisis O
, O
which O
erupted O
in O
March O
when O
Britain O
acknowledged O
humans O
could O
contract O
a O
similar O
illness O
by O
eating O
contaminated O
beef O
. O

The O
European O
Commission O
agreed O
this O
month O
to O
rethink O
a O
proposal O
to O
ban O
the O
use O
of O
suspect O
sheep O
tissue O
after O
some O
EU O
veterinary O
experts O
questioned O
whether O
it O
was O
justified O
. O

EU O
Farm O
Commissioner O
Franz B-PERSON
Fischler E-PERSON
had O
proposed O
banning O
sheep O
brains O
, O
spleens O
and O
spinal O
cords O
from O
the O
human O
and O
animal O
food O
chains O
after O
reports O
from O
Britain O
and O
France O
that O
under O
laboratory O
conditions O
sheep O
could O
contract O
Bovine O
Spongiform O
Encephalopathy O
( O
BSE O
) O
-- O
mad O
cow O
disease O
. O

But O
some O
members O
of O
the O
EU O
's O
standing O
veterinary O
committee O
questioned O
whether O
the O
action O
was O
necessary O
given O
the O
slight O
risk O
to O
human O
health O
. O

The O
question O
is O
being O
studied O
separately O
by O
two O
EU O
scientific O
committees O
. O

Sheep O
have O
long O
been O
known O
to O
contract O
scrapie O
, O
a O
similar O
brain-wasting O
disease O
to O
BSE O
which O
is O
believed O
to O
have O
been O
transferred O
to O
cattle O
through O
feed O
containing O
animal O
waste O
. O

British O
officials O
say O
sheep O
meat O
is O
perfectly O
safe O
to O
eat O
. O

ZDF O
said O
Germany O
imported O
47,600 O
sheep O
from O
Britain O
last O
year O
, O
nearly O
half O
of O
total O
imports O
. O

It O
brought O
in O
4,275 O
tonnes O
of O
British O
mutton O
, O
some O
10 O
percent O
of O
overall O
imports O
. O

After O
the O
British O
government O
admitted O
a O
possible O
link O
between O
mad O
cow O
disease O
and O
its O
fatal O
human O
equivalent O
, O
the O
EU O
imposed O
a O
worldwide O
ban O
on O
British O
beef O
exports O
. O

EU O
leaders O
agreed O
at O
a O
summit O
in O
June O
to O
a O
progressive O
lifting O
of O
the O
ban O
as O
Britain O
takes O
parallel O
measures O
to O
eradicate O
the O
disease O
. O

TENNIS O
- O
NEWCOMBE S-PERSON
PONDERS O
HIS O
DAVIS O
CUP O
FUTURE O
. O

SYDNEY O
1996-08-22 O

Australian O
Davis O
Cup O
captain O
John B-PERSON
Newcombe E-PERSON
on O
Thursday O
signalled O
his O
possible O
resignation O
if O
his O
team O
loses O
an O
away O
tie O
against O
Croatia O
next O
month O
. O

The O
former O
Wimbledon O
champion O
said O
the O
immediate O
future O
of O
Australia O
's O
Davis O
Cup O
coach O
Tony B-PERSON
Roche E-PERSON
could O
also O
be O
determined O
by O
events O
in O
Split O
. O

" O
If O
we O
lose O
this O
one O
, O
Tony S-PERSON
and O
I O
will O
have O
to O
have O
a O
good O
look O
at O
giving O
someone O
else O
a O
go O
, O
" O
Newcombe S-PERSON
was O
quoted O
as O
saying O
in O
Sydney O
's O
Daily O
Telegraph O
newspaper O
. O

Australia O
face O
Croatia O
in O
the O
world O
group O
qualifying O
tie O
on O
clay O
from O
September O
20-22 O
. O

Under O
Newcombe S-PERSON
's O
leadership O
, O
Australia O
were O
relegated O
from O
the O
elite O
world O
group O
last O
year O
, O
the O
first O
time O
the O
26-time O
Davis O
Cup O
winners O
had O
slipped O
from O
the O
top O
rank O
. O

Since O
taking O
over O
as O
captain O
from O
Neale B-PERSON
Fraser E-PERSON
in O
1994 O
, O
Newcombe S-PERSON
's O
record O
in O
tandem O
with O
Roche S-PERSON
, O
his O
former O
doubles O
partner O
, O
has O
been O
three O
wins O
and O
three O
losses O
. O

Newcombe S-PERSON
has O
selected O
Wimbledon O
semifinalist O
Jason B-PERSON
Stoltenberg E-PERSON
, O
Patrick B-PERSON
Rafter E-PERSON
, O
Mark B-PERSON
Philippoussis E-PERSON
, O
and O
Olympic O
doubles O
champions O
Todd B-PERSON
Woodbridge E-PERSON
and O
Mark B-PERSON
Woodforde E-PERSON
to O
face O
the O
Croatians O
. O

The O
home O
side O
boasts O
world O
number O
six O
Goran B-PERSON
Ivanisevic E-PERSON
, O
and O
Newcombe S-PERSON
conceded O
his O
players O
would O
be O
hard-pressed O
to O
beat O
the O
Croatian O
number O
one O
. O

" O
We O
are O
ready O
to O
fight O
to O
our O
last O
breath O
-- O
Australia O
must O
play O
at O
its O
absolute O
best O
to O
win O
, O
" O
said O
Newcombe S-PERSON
, O
who O
described O
the O
tie O
as O
the O
toughest O
he O
has O
faced O
as O

. O

last O

Cup O
in O
1986 O
, O
but O

were O

finalists O
against O
Germany O
three O
years O
ago O

's O

. O

BASEBALL O
- O
ORIOLES O
' O
MANAGER O
DAVEY B-PERSON
JOHNSON E-PERSON
HOSPITALIZED O
. O

BALTIMORE O
1996-08-22 O

Baltimore O
Orioles O
manager O
Davey B-PERSON
Johnson E-PERSON
will O
miss O
Thursday O
night O
's O
game O
against O
the O
Seattle O
Mariners O
after O
being O
admitted O
to O
a O
hospital O
with O
an O
irregular O
heartbeat O
. O

The O
53-year-old O
Johnson S-PERSON
was O
hospitalized O
after O
experiencing O
dizziness O
. O

" O
He O
is O
in O
no O
danger O
and O
will O
be O
treated O
and O
observed O
this O
evening O
, O
" O
said O
Orioles O
team O
physician O
Dr. O
William B-PERSON
Goldiner E-PERSON
, O
adding O
that O
Johnson S-PERSON
is O
expected O
to O
be O
released O
on O
Friday O
. O

Orioles O
' O
bench O
coach O
Andy B-PERSON
Etchebarren E-PERSON
will O
manage O
the O
club O
in O
Johnson S-PERSON
's O
absence O
. O

Johnson S-PERSON
is O
the O
second O
manager O
to O
be O
hospitalized O
this O
week O
after O
California O
Angels O
skipper O
John B-PERSON
McNamara E-PERSON
was O
admitted O
to O
New O
York O
's O
Columbia O
Presbyterian O
Hospital O
on O
Wednesday O
with O
a O
blood O
clot O
in O
his O
left O
calf O
. O

Johnson S-PERSON
, O
who O
played O
eight O
seasons O
in O
Baltimore O
, O
was O
named O
Orioles O
manager O
in O
the O
off-season O
replacing O
Phil B-PERSON
Regan E-PERSON
. O

He O
led O
the O
Cincinnati O
Reds O
to O
the O
National O
League O
Championship O
Series O
last O
year O
and O
guided O
the O
New O
York O
Mets O
to O
a O
World O
Series O
championship O
in O
1986 O
. O

Baltimore O
has O
won O
16 O
of O
its O
last O
22 O
games O
to O
pull O
within O
five O
games O
of O

New O
York O
Yankees O
in O
the O
American O
League O
East O
Division O
. O

- O

's O

metres O
. O

exposure O
can O

to O
bowel O
disease O
- O

. O

LONDON O
1996-08-23 O

Women O
who O
get O
measles O
while O
pregnant O
may O
have O
babies O
at O
higher O
risk O
of O
Crohn S-PERSON
's O
disease O
, O
a O
debilitating O
bowel O
disorder O
, O
researchers O
said O
on O
Friday O
. O

Three O
out O
of O
four O
Swedish O
babies O
born O
to O
mothers O
who O
caught O
measles O
developed O
serious O
cases O
of O
Crohn S-PERSON
's O
disease O
, O
the O
researchers O
said O
. O

Dr O
Andrew B-PERSON
Wakefield E-PERSON
of O
the O
Royal O
Free O
Hospital O
School O
of O
Medicine O
and O
colleagues O
screened O
25,000 O
babies O
delivered O
at O
University O
Hospital O
, O
Uppsala O
, O
between O
1940 O
and O
1949 O
. O

Four O
of O
the O
mothers O
had O
measles O
while O
pregnant O
. O

" O
Three O
of O
the O
four O
children O
had O
Crohn S-PERSON
's O
disease O
, O
" O
Wakefield S-PERSON
's O
group O
wrote O
in O
the O
Lancet O
medical O
journal O
. O

Crohn S-PERSON
's O
is O
an O
inflammation O
of O
the O
bowel O
that O
can O
sometimes O
require O
surgery O
. O

It O
causes O
diarrhoea O
, O
abdominal O
pain O
and O
weight O
loss O
. O

The O
researchers O
said O
the O
three O
children O
involved O
had O
especially O
severe O
cases O
. O

Exposure O
to O
viruses O
can O
often O
cause O
birth O
defects O
. O

Most O
notably O
, O
women O
who O
get O
rubella O
( O
German O
measles O
) O
have O
a O
high O
risk O
of O
a O
stillborn O
baby O
. O

Garlic O

cholesterol O
and O

that O

do O
not O
benefit O
significantly O
from O
taking O
garlic O
tablets O
. O

The O
study O
involved O
115 O
people O
with O
high O
blood O
cholesterol O
levels O
. O

They O
were O
given O
900 O
milligrams O
a O
day O
of O
dried O
garlic O
powder O
or O
placebo O
tablets O
. O
" O

There O
were O
no O
significant O
differences O
between O
the O
groups O
receiving O
garlic O
and O
placebo O
, O
" O
they O
wrote O
in O
the O
Journal O
of O
the O
Royal O
College O
of O
Physicians O
. O

Those O
taking O
part O
were O
told O
to O
eat O
a O
low-fat O
diet O
for O
six O
weeks O
before O
they O
started O
taking O
the O
pills O
, O
and O
their O
blood O
cholesterol O
measured O
before O
and O
after O
the O
six-week O
period O
. O

The O
researchers O
said O
this O
would O
make O
their O
findings O
more O
accurate O
. O

Several O
studies O
have O
found O
garlic O
pills O
can O
lower O
blood O
pressure O
and O
blood O
cholesterol O
. O

But O
the O
Oxford O
team O
disputed O
these O
findings O
and O
said O
either O
previous O
trials O
may O
have O
been O
interpreted O
incorrectly O
, O
those O
taking O
part O
were O
not O
given O
special O
diets O
beforehand O
or O
the O
duration O
of O
the O
studies O
may O
have O
been O
too O
short O
. O

The O
six-month O
trial O
was O
funded O
by O
the O
British O
Heart O
Foundation O
and O
Lichtwer O
Pharma O
GmbH O
, O
which O
makes O
Kwai O
brand O
garlic O
tablets O
. O

The O
study O
did O
not O
address O
whether O
whole O
garlic O
could O
affect O
cholesterol O
. O

-- O

Newsroom O
+44 O

7950 O

. O

9373-1800 O

KUALA O

1996-08-22 O

Malaysia O

, O

" O

) O

, O
" O

Ukraine O
hails O
peace O
as O
marks O
five-year O
independence O
. O

Rostislav B-PERSON
Khotin E-PERSON

KIEV O
1996-08-23 O

Ukraine O
celebrates O
five O
years O
of O
independence O
from O
Kremlin O
rule O
on O
Saturday O
, O
hailing O
civil O
and O
inter-ethnic O
peace O
as O
its O
main O
post-Soviet O
achievement O
. O

Ukraine O
's O
declaration O
of O
independence O
in O
1991 O
, O
backed O
nine-to-one O
by O
a O
referendum O
in O
December O
of O
that O
year O
, O
effectively O
dealt O
a O
death O
blow O
to O
the O
Soviet O
empire O
and O
ended O
more O
than O
three O
centuries O
of O
rule O
from O
Moscow O
. O

Ukraine O
, O
with O
a O
Russian O
community O
of O
11 O
million O
people O
-- O
the O
world O
's O
largest O
outside O
Russia O
-- O
has O
avoided O
conflicts O
like O
those O
in O
Russia O
's O
Chechnya O
, O
neighbouring O
Moldova O
, O
and O
the O
former O
Soviet O
republics O
of O
Georgia O
, O
Azerbaijan O
and O
Tajikistan O
. O

" O
Ukraine O
's O
biggest O
achievements O
for O
five O
years O
are O
the O
preservation O
of O
civil O
peace O
and O
inter-ethnic O
harmony O
, O
" O
President O
Leonid B-PERSON
Kuchma E-PERSON
said O
in O
televised O
statement O
this O
week O
. O

" O
Unlike O
many O
other O
post-Soviet O
countries O
we O
were O
able O
to O
deal O
with O
conflict O
situations O
in O
a O
peaceful O
and O
civilised O
way O
. O
" O

But O
independence O
was O
initially O
accompanied O
by O
hyper-inflation O
and O
economic O
collapse O
, O
although O
there O
are O
signs O
of O
a O
turnaround O
. O

Inflation O
-- O
a O
hyper-inflationary O
10,300 O
percent O
a O
year O
in O
1993 O
-- O
was O
a O
respectable O
0.1 O
percent O
a O
month O
in O
June O
and O
July O
and O
the O
economy O
has O
just O
begun O
to O
grow O
. O

Kuchma S-PERSON
told O
a O
solemn O
ceremony O
at O
the O
Ukraina O
Palace O
on O
Friday O
that O
" O
there O
was O
a O
turning O
point O
" O
in O
reforms O
and O
that O
he O
expected O
a O
rise O
in O
the O
standard O
of O
living O
in O
the O
near O
future O
. O

" O
There O
is O
no O
doubt O
that O
economic O
growth O
has O
already O
started O
, O
" O
said O
Adelbert B-PERSON
Knobl E-PERSON
, O
head O
of O
the O
International O
Monetary O
Fund O
's O
mission O
in O
Ukraine O
. O
" O

The O
national O
bank O
and O
the O
government O
have O
every O
reason O
to O
be O
proud O
of O
their O
efforts O
. O
" O

Central O
bank O
officials O
said O
on O
Thursday O
that O
a O
much-postponed O
hryvna O
currency O
would O
" O
definitely O
" O
be O
introduced O
before O
the O
end O
of O
this O
year O
. O

It O
will O
replace O
the O
interim O
karbovanets O
currency O
, O
which O
was O
introduced O
at O
par O
to O
the O
Russian O
rouble O
in O
1992 O
but O
now O
trades O
at O
almost O
33 O
karbovanets O
per O
rouble O
. O

Ukraine O
has O
repeatedly O
promised O
to O
introduce O
the O
hryvna O
but O
had O
to O
postpone O
the O
plans O
because O
of O
economic O
problems O
. O

Proud O
of O
its O
record O
in O
promptly O
joining O
both O
the O
Council O
of O
Europe O
and O
NATO O
's O
Partnership O
for O
Peace O
, O
Ukraine O
caused O
a O
foreign O
policy O
wrangle O
this O
week O
, O
offending O
China O
by O
allowing O
a O
Taiwanese O
minister O
to O
appear O
on O
a O
public O
, O
if O
unofficial O
visit O
. O

China O
cancelled O
a O
visit O
by O
a O
top-level O
delegation O
in O
protest O
. O

Kiev O
's O
Foreign O
Minister O
Hennady B-PERSON
Udovenko E-PERSON
said O
Beijing O
was O
overreacting O
. O

But O
Ukraine O
, O
seeing O
itself O
as O
a O
bridge O
between O
Russia O
and O
the O
rapidly O
Westernising O
countries O
of O
eastern O
Europe O
, O
is O
looking O
West O
as O
well O
as O
East O
. O

" O
The O
strategic O
aim O
of O
European O
integration O
should O
not O
in O
any O
way O
damage O
Ukraine O
's O
interests O
in O
post-Soviet O
areas O
. O

Relations O
with O
Russia O
, O
which O
is O
our O
main O
partner O
, O
have O
great O
importance O
, O
" O
Kuchma S-PERSON
said O
. O

" O
But O
Ukraine O
cannot O
be O
economically O
oriented O
on O
Russia O
, O
even O
though O
those O
in O
some O
circles O
push O
us O
to O
do O
that O
. O
" O

Kuchma S-PERSON
has O
said O
Kiev O
wants O
membership O
of O
the O
European O
Union O
, O
associate O
membership O
of O
the O
Western O
European O
Union O
defence O
grouping O
and O
to O
move O
closer O
to O
NATO O
. O

A O
message O
from O
the O
West O
this O
week O
from O
U.S. O
President O
Bill B-PERSON
Clinton E-PERSON
congratulated O
Ukraine O
on O
the O
anniversary O
, O
promising O
to O
support O
market O
reforms O
and O
praising O
Ukraine O
as O
a O
" O
stabilising O
factor O
" O
in O
a O
united O
Europe O
. O

on O

. O

Gazeta O
Shqiptare O
said O
the O
" O

of O
Mass O
' O
, O
by O
Gjon B-PERSON
Buzuku E-PERSON

from O
1555 O

1740 O

a O

in O

, O

the O

, O

Russia O
to O
clamp O
down O
on O

deals O
. O

MOSCOW O
1996-08-23 O

Russian O
officials O
, O
keen O
to O
cut O
capital O
flight O
, O
will O
adopt O

to O

barter O
deals O
in O
foreign O
trade O
to O
a O
minimum O
, O
a O

on O
Friday O
. O

" O
We O
have O
always O
been O
concerned O
about O
barter O
deals O
with O
other O
countries O
, O
viewing O
them O
as O
a O
disguised O
kind O
of O

flight O
from O
Russia O
, O
" O
Marina B-PERSON
Volkova E-PERSON
, O

of O
the O

at O
the O
State O

Committee O
, O
told O
Reuters O
. O

Volkova S-PERSON
said O
last O
year O
goods O
had O
been O
exported O
under O
many O
Russian O
barter O
deals O
, O
with O
nothing O
imported O
in O
return O
. O

She O
said O
the O
cost O
of O
such O
unimported O
goods O
was O
$ O
1.10 O
billion O
in O
1995 O
. O

Barter O
deals O
were O
worth O
$ O
4.9 O
billion O
last O
year O
, O
or O
about O
eight O
percent O
of O
all O
Russian O
exports O
estimated O
at O
$ O
61.5 O
billion O
, O
she O
said O
. O

" O
The O
cost O
of O
exported O
goods O
is O
too O
often O
understated O
, O
so O
the O
actual O
share O
of O
barter O
deals O
in O
Russian O
exports O
and O
the O
amount O
of O
unimported O
goods O
may O
be O
even O
higher O
, O
" O
Volkova S-PERSON
said O
. O

A O
few O
days O
ago O
Russian O
President O
Boris B-PERSON
Yeltsin E-PERSON
issued O
a O
decree O
on O
state O
regulation O
of O
foreign O
barter O
deals O
, O
and O
Volkova S-PERSON
said O
this O
" O
could O
substantially O
improve O
the O
situation O
" O
. O

In O
line O
with O
the O
decree O
, O
which O
will O
come O
into O
force O
on O
November O
1 O
, O
all O
Russian O
barter O
traders O
will O
be O
obliged O
to O
import O
goods O
worth O
the O
cost O
of O
their O
exports O
within O
180 O
days O
. O

" O
If O
traders O
are O
late O
, O
they O
will O
have O
to O
pay O
fines O
worth O
the O
cost O
of O
their O
exported O
goods O
, O
" O
Volkova S-PERSON
said O
. O

Understating O
the O
cost O
of O
exported O
goods O
could O
still O
be O
a O
loophole O
for O
barter O
dealers O
, O
but O
Volkova S-PERSON
said O
the O
authorities O
are O
currently O
" O
tackling O
the O
technicalities O
of O
the O
issue O
" O
. O

Barter O
has O
always O
been O
a O
feature O
of O
the O
Soviet O
Union O
's O
foreign O
trade O
, O
but O
Yeltsin S-PERSON
's O
decrees O
liberalising O
foreign O
trade O
in O
1991-1992 O
has O
given O

a O
new O
impetus O
. O

A O

years O
ago O
, O
barter O
deals O
accounted O
for O
up O
to O
25-30 O
percent O
of O
Russian O

because O
" O
thousands O
( O
of O
) O
trade O
companies O
which O
popped O
up O
preferred O
barter O
in O
the O
absence O
of O
reliable O
Russian O
banks O
and O
money O
transfer O
systems O
" O
, O
Volkova S-PERSON
said O
. O

" O
Now O
many O

banks O
are O
strong O
and O
can O
make O
various O
sorts O
of O
money O
tranfers O
, O
while O
incompetent O
traders O
are O
being O
ousted O
by O
more O
experienced O
ones O
. O

But O
the O
current O
share O
of O
barter O
deals O
in O
Russian O
exports O
is O
still O
high O
, O
" O
she O
said O
. O

-- O
Dmitry B-PERSON
Solovyov E-PERSON
, O
Moscow O
Newsroom O
, O

CRICKET O
- O
CRAWLEY S-PERSON

LONDON O

England O

John B-PERSON

perspective O
. O

" O

I O
was O

" O

was O

with O

over O

MASTERKOVA S-PERSON
BREAKS O
SECOND O
WORLD O
RECORD O
IN O
10 O
DAYS O
. O

Adrian B-PERSON
Warner E-PERSON

BRUSSELS O
1996-08-23 O

Russia O
's O
double O
Olympic O
champion O
Svetlana B-PERSON
Masterkova E-PERSON
smashed O
her O
second O
world O
record O
in O
just O
10 O
days O
on O
Friday O
when O
she O
bettered O
the O
mark O
for O
the O
women O
's O
1,000 O
metres O
. O

After O
breaking O
the O
world O
record O
for O
the O
women O
's O
mile O
in O
Zurich O
last O
Wednesday O
, O
the O
Olympic O
800 O
and O
1,500 O
metres O
champion O
clocked O
two O
minutes O
28.98 O
seconds O
over O
1,000 O
at O
the O
Brussels O
grand O
prix O
meeting O
. O

The O
Russian O
ate O
up O
the O
ground O
in O
a O
swift O
last O
lap O
to O
shave O
0.36 O
seconds O
off O
the O
previous O
best O
of O
2:29.34 O
set O
by O
Mozambique O
's O
Maria B-PERSON
Mutola E-PERSON
in O
the O
same O
stadium O
in O
August O
last O
year O
. O

Former O
world O
800 O
champion O
Mutola S-PERSON
pushed O
Masterkova S-PERSON
all O
the O
way O
, O
finishing O
second O
in O
2:29.66 O
. O

But O
it O
was O
the O
Russian O
who O
picked O
up O
the O
bonus O
of O
$ O
25,000 O
for O
the O
historic O
run O
in O
front O
of O
a O
capacity O
40,000 O
crowd O
. O

Masterkova S-PERSON
dominated O
the O
middle-distance O
races O
at O
the O
recent O
Atlanta O
Games O
following O
her O
return O
to O
competition O
this O
season O
after O
a O
three-year O
maternity O
break O
. O

In O
her O
first O
mile O
race O
at O
the O
richest O
meeting O
in O
Zurich O
last O
Wednesday O
, O
she O
slashed O
3.05 O
seconds O
off O
the O
previous O
record O
. O

The O
record O
of O
four O
minutes O
, O
12.56 O
seconds O
in O
Zurich O
earned O
Masterkova S-PERSON
a O
bonus O
of O
$ O
50,000 O
plus O
one O
kilo O
of O
gold O
. O

After O
Friday O
's O
performance O
the O
Russian O
will O
have O
earned O
well O
over O
$ O
100,000 O
in O
less O
than O
a O
fortnight O
, O

money O
into O
account O
. O

had O

new O
track O
for O

to O
the O

down O
on O
a O

surface O
. O

Masterkova S-PERSON

it O
. O

the O

on O

clock O

as O
she O
crossed O
the O
line O
. O

- O
MITCHELL S-PERSON
UPSTAGES O
TRIO O
OF O
OLYMPIC O
SPRINT O
CHAMPIONS O
. O

Adrian B-PERSON
Warner E-PERSON

BRUSSELS O
1996-08-23 O

American O
Dennis B-PERSON
Mitchell E-PERSON
upstaged O
a O
trio O
of O
past O
and O
present O
Olympic O
100 O
metres O
champions O
on O
Friday O
with O
a O
storming O
victory O
at O
the O
Brussels O
grand O
prix O
. O

Sporting O
his O
customary O
bright O
green O
outfit O
, O
the O
U.S. O
champion O
clocked O
10.03 O
seconds O
despite O
damp O
conditions O
to O
take O
the O
scalp O
of O
Canada O
's O
reigning O
Olympic O
champion O
Donovan B-PERSON
Bailey E-PERSON
, O
1992 O
champion O
Linford B-PERSON
Christie E-PERSON
of O
Britain O
and O
American O
1984 O
and O
1988 O
champion O
Carl B-PERSON
Lewis E-PERSON
. O

Mitchell S-PERSON
also O
beat O
world O
and O
Olympic O
champion O
Bailey S-PERSON
at O
the O
most O
lucrative O
meeting O
in O
the O
sport O
in O
Zurich O
last O
week O
. O

The O
American O
, O
who O
finished O
fourth O
at O
the O
Atlanta O
Games O
, O
was O
fast O
out O
of O
his O
blocks O
and O
held O
off O
Bailey S-PERSON
's O
late O
burst O
in O
the O
final O
20 O
metres O
before O
heading O
off O
for O
a O
lap O
of O
celebration O
. O

The O
Canadian O
was O
second O
in O
10.09 O
with O
Lewis S-PERSON
third O
in O
10.10 O
, O
ahead O
of O
Atlanta O
bronze O
medallist O
Ato B-PERSON
Boldon E-PERSON
who O
clocked O
10.12 O
in O
fourth O
. O

Christie S-PERSON
, O
competing O
in O
what O
is O
expected O
to O
be O
his O
last O
major O
international O

, O
finished O
fifth O
in O

. O

Lewis S-PERSON
, O

appearance O
in O
Europe O
in O

race O
, O
left O
the O
track O
with O
a O

. O

American O
Olympic O
high O
hurdles O
champion O
Allen B-PERSON
Johnson E-PERSON
defied O
the O
wet O
conditions O
to O
produce O
a O

12.92 O
seconds O
in O
the O

metres O
race O
, O
just O
0.01 O
outside O

world O

held O
by O

's O
Colin B-PERSON
Jackson E-PERSON
. O

ran O

at O

in O

in O

with O

at O

. O

to O

faster O

could O
not O
live O
with O
his O

second O
in O

. O

when O

CRICKET O
- O
SRI O
LANKA O
AND O
AUSTRALIA O
SAY O
RELATIONS O
HAVE O
HEALED O
. O

COLOMBO O
1996-08-23 O

Sri O
Lanka O
and O
Australia O
agreed O
on O
Friday O
that O
relations O
between O
the O
two O
teams O
had O
healed O
since O
the O
Sri O
Lankans O
' O
acrimonious O
tour O
last O
year O
. O

The O
Sri O
Lankans O
were O
first O
found O
guilty O
then O
cleared O
of O
ball O
tampering O
and O
off-spinner O
Muttiah B-PERSON
Muralitharan E-PERSON
was O
called O
for O
throwing O
during O
a O
controversial O
three-test O
series O
in O
Australia O
. O

" O
Our O
concern O
is O
to O
get O
out O
there O
and O
play O
proper O
cricket O
, O
" O
Sri O
Lanka O
captain O
Arjuna B-PERSON
Ranatunga E-PERSON
told O
a O
news O
conference O
on O
the O
eve O
of O
a O
warmup O
match O
between O
the O
World O
Cup O
champions O
and O
a O
World O
XI O
team O
scheduled O
for O
Saturday O
. O

" O
What O
happened O
is O
history O
. O
" O

Australian O
team O
manager O
Cam B-PERSON
Battersby E-PERSON
said O
he O
agreed O
with O
Ranatunga S-PERSON
. O

" O
I O
believe O
relations O
between O
the O
two O
teams O
will O
be O
excellent O
, O
" O
Batterby S-PERSON
said O
. O

The O
Australians O
are O
making O
their O
first O
visit O
to O
the O
Indian O
Ocean O
island O
since O
boycotting O
a O

Cup O
fixture O
in O
February O
after O
a O
terrorist O
bomb O
in O
Colombo O
. O

Australia O
have O
been O
promised O
the O
presence O
of O
commandos O
, O
sniffer O
dogs O
and O
plainclothes O
policemen O
to O
ensure O
a O
limited O
overs O
tournament O
is O
trouble-free O
. O

The O
tournament O
, O
starting O
on O
August O
26 O
, O
also O
includes O
India O
and O
Zimbabwe O
. O

Battersby S-PERSON
said O
he O
was O
satisfied O
with O
the O
security O
arrangements O
. O

Sri O
Lankan O
officials O
said O
they O
expected O
heavy O
rain O
which O
washed O
out O
a O

match O
on O
Friday O
should O
cease O
by O
Saturday O
. O

Australia O
, O

by O

Ian B-PERSON

, O

LUANDA O
1996-08-23 O

. O

Reuters O
has O
not O

these O

and O
does O
not O

for O
their O

. O

- O
- O
- O
- O

JORNAL O
DE O
ANGOLA O

- O
The O
Angolan O
Chief O
of O
State O
addressed O
a O
letter O
to O
UN O
Security O
Council O
proposing O
dates O
for O
the O
conclusion O
of O
the O
peace O
process O
in O
Angola O
. O

He O
proposed O
definite O
dates O
, O
August O
25 O
for O
return O
of O
Unita O
generals O
to O
the O
joint O
army O
, O
September O
5 O
for O
the O
beginning O
of O
the O
formation O
of O
the O
Government O
of O
National O
Unity O
and O
Reconciliation O
. O

Until O
this O
date O
the O
free O
circulation O
of O
peoples O
and O
goods O
should O
be O
guaranteed O
, O
the O
government O
administration O
installed O
in O
all O
areas O
and O
the O
Unita O
deputies O
should O
occupy O
their O
places O
in O
the O
National O
Assembly O
. O

The O
president O
justified O
his O
proposal O
by O
the O
delays O
verified O
in O
the O
peace O
process O
, O
including O
the O
fact O
that O
areas O
under O
Unita O
control O
or O
occupation O
have O
not O
been O
effectively O
demilitarised O
, O
where O
the O
Unita O
military O
forces O
have O
been O
substituted O
by O
their O
so-called O
police O
. O

- O
President O
Dos B-PERSON
Santos E-PERSON
proposes O
the O
establishment O
by O
UN O
Security O
Council O
of O
definitive O
and O
final O
timetable O
for O
the O
tasks O
and O

under O

and O

of O
a O
mission O
of O
SC O
, O
as O
soon O
as O
possible O
, O
to O

of O
the O
agreement O
. O

of O

raises O
Property O
Capital O
stake O
. O

WASHINGTON O
1996-08-23 O

Omaha O
billionaire O
Warren B-PERSON
Buffett E-PERSON
said O
Friday O
he O
raised O
his O
stake O
in O
Property O
Capital O
Trust O
to O
8.0 O
percent O
from O
6.7 O
percent O
. O

In O
a O
filing O
with O
the O
Securities O
and O
Exchnage O
Commission O
, O
Buffett S-PERSON
said O
he O
bought O
62,900 O
additional O
common O
shares O
of O
the O
Boston-based O
real O
estate O
investment O
trust O
at O
prices O
ranging O
from O
$ O
7.65 O
to O
$ O
8.02 O
a O
share O
. O

The O
purchases O
increased O
his O
holding O
in O
the O
company O
to O
725,900 O
shares O
, O
which O
was O
purchased O
for O
a O
total O
of O
$ O
6.2 O
million O
, O
he O
said O
. O

Buffett S-PERSON
, O
who O
is O
well-known O
as O
a O
long-term O

, O
is O

of O

Inc O
, O
a O
holding O
company O
through O
which O
he O
holds O

in O
several O

U.S. O
companies O

Colombia O
, O
U.S. O
reach O
aviation O
agreement O
. O

MIAMI O
1996-08-23 O

The O
U.S. O
and O
Colombian O
governments O
reached O
an O
agreement O
that O
will O
allow O
AMR O
Corp O
's O
American O
Airlines O
to O
operate O
three O
round-trip O
flights O
between O
New O
York O
and O
Bogota O
, O
the O
Department O
of O
Transportation O
said O
Friday O
. O

Under O
the O
agreement O
, O
which O
followed O
talks O
in O
Miami O
this O
week O
, O
AMR O
also O
will O
be O
allowed O
to O
shift O
up O
to O
four O
of O
the O
weekly O
flights O
it O
now O
operates O
between O
Miami O
and O
Colombia O
to O
its O
New O
York O
gateway O
. O

The O
United O
States O
also O
will O
be O
able O
to O
designate O
one O
new O
all-cargo O
carrier O
for O
service O
between O
the O
two O
nations O
after O
two O
years O
. O

Colombia O
was O
permitted O
to O
add O
a O
single O
additional O
round-trip O
flight O
to O
its O
current O
New O
York O
service O
, O
although O
it O
will O
not O
be O
able O
to O
do O
so O
while O
under O
Category O
Two O
( O
Conditional O
) O
status O
under O
the O
Federal O
Aviation O
Administration O
's O
International O
Aviation O
Safety O
program O
. O

Colombia O
would O
be O
allowed O
to O
add O
new O
service O
when O
its O
safety O
assessment O
has O
been O
improved O
, O
the O
department O
said O
. O

With O
the O
exception O
of O
the O
new O
services O
just O
agreed O
to O
, O
the O
governments O
of O
the O
two O
nations O
have O
agreed O
to O
maintain O
their O
current O
level O
of O
routes O
and O
airlines O
for O
the O
next O
2-1/2 O
years O
, O
the O
agreement O
said O
. O

The O
agreement O
resolved O
a O
dispute O
that O
arose O
in O
June O
when O
Colombia O
turned O
down O
American O
's O
request O
to O
operate O
flights O
between O
New O
York O
and O
Bogota O
, O
a O
denial O
that O
prompted O
the O
United O
States O
to O
charge O
that O
the O
Colombians O
were O
breaking O
a O
bilateral O
aviation O
agreement O
and O
to O
propose O
sanctions O
against O
one O
of O
two O
Colombian O
airlines O
, O
Avianca O
and O
ACES O
. O

- O
Golf O
: O
Norman S-PERSON
sacks O
his O

after O
disappointing O
season O
. O

SYDNEY O
1996-08-23 O

World O
number O
one O
golfer O
Greg B-PERSON
Norman E-PERSON
has O
sacked O
his O
coach O
Butch B-PERSON
Harmon E-PERSON
after O
a O
disappointing O
season O
. O

" O
Butch S-PERSON
and O
I O
are O
finished O
, O
" O
Norman S-PERSON
told O
reporters O
on O
Thursday O
before O
the O
start O
of O
the O
World O
Series O
of O
Golf O
in O
Akron O
, O
Ohio O
. O

Norman S-PERSON
, O
a O
two-time O
British O
Open O
champion O
, O
parted O
ways O
with O
his O
long-time O
mentor O
after O
drawing O
a O
blank O
in O
this O
year O
's O
four O
majors O
, O
winning O
two O
tournaments O
worldwide O
. O

The O
blonde O
Australian O
opened O
with O
a O
level O
par O
round O
of O
70 O
in O
Akron O
, O
leaving O
him O
four O
shots O
adrift O
of O
the O
leaders O
, O
Americans O
Billy B-PERSON
Mayfair E-PERSON
and O
Paul B-PERSON
Goydos E-PERSON
and O
Japan O
's O
Hidemichi B-PERSON
Tanaki E-PERSON
. O

On O
Wednesday O
Norman S-PERSON
described O
this O
year O
as O
his O
worst O
on O
the O
professional O
circuit O
since O
1991 O
, O
when O
he O
failed O
to O
win O
a O
tournament O
. O

" O
My O
application O
this O
year O
has O
been O
strange O
, O
" O
Norman S-PERSON
said O
. O
" O

Maybe O
I O
have O
n't O
been O
as O
keyed O
up O
as O
I O
should O
have O
been O
. O
" O

" O
Sometimes O
you O
do O
n't O
have O
it O
in O
your O
head O
to O
play O
. O

Maybe O
this O
was O
one O
of O
those O
years O
where O
I O
was O
there O
, O
but O
I O
was O
n't O
100 O
percent O
there O
, O
and O

to O

100 O

, O
" O
he O
said O
. O

Soccer O
- O
Arab O
team O
breaks O
new O
ground O
in O
Israel O
. O

Ori B-PERSON
Lewis E-PERSON

TAIBE O
, O
Israel O
1996-08-23 O

For O
the O
first O
time O
in O
Israeli O
history O
, O
an O
Arab O
team O
will O
take O
the O
field O
when O
the O
National O
League O
soccer O
season O
starts O
on O
Saturday O
. O

Hapoel O
Taibe O
fields O
four O
Jewish O
players O
and O
two O
foreign O
imports O
-- O
a O
Pole O
and O
a O
Romanian O
. O

The O
rest O
of O
the O
side O
is O
made O
up O
mainly O
of O
Moslem O
Arabs O
. O

The O
club O
, O
founded O
in O
1961 O
, O
has O
a O
loyal O
following O
in O
Taibe O
, O
an O
Arab O
town O
of O
28,000 O
in O
the O
heart O
of O
Israel O
. O

But O
away O
from O
their O
home O
ground O
, O
they O
face O
unfriendly O
crowds O
who O
taunt O
the O
players O
with O
racist O
abuse O
. O

" O
The O
very O
first O
thing O
we O
thought O
about O
after O
we O
knew O
we O
would O
be O
promoted O
was O
the O
game O
against O
Betar O
Jerusalem O
, O
" O
said O
Taibe O
supporter O
Karem B-PERSON
Haj I-PERSON
Yihye E-PERSON
. O

Two O
weeks O
ago O
Taibe O
, O
coached O
by O
Pole O
Wojtek B-PERSON
Lazarek E-PERSON
, O
met O
Betar O
, O
a O
club O
closely O
associated O
with O
the O
right-wing O
Likud O
party O
, O
for O
the O
first O
time O
in O
a O
Cup O
match O
in O
Jerusalem O
. O

Chants O
from O
the O
crowd O
of O
" O
Death O
to O
the O
Arabs O
" O
, O
and O
bottle-throwing O
during O
the O
game O
marred O
the O
match O
which O
ended O
in O
a O
goalless O
draw O
. O

One O
Taibe O
supporter O
required O
hospital O
treatment O
for O
cuts O
and O
bruises O
after O
a O
stone O
struck O
his O
head O
as O
he O
was O
driving O
from O
the O
stadium O
. O

" O
We O
're O
used O
to O
hearing O
the O
taunts O
of O
" O
Death O
to O
the O
Arabs O
' O
, O
" O
said O
Sameh B-PERSON
Haj I-PERSON
Yihye E-PERSON
, O
a O
Taibe O
resident O
who O
studies O
at O
Jerusalem O
's O
Hebrew O
University O
. O
" O

But O
we O
know O
that O
these O
are O
only O
words O
, O
nobody O
has O
died O
from O
hearing O
them O
and O
it O
only O
makes O
us O
support O
our O
team O
more O
vehemently O
. O
" O

The O
dusty O
town O
of O
Taibe O
lacks O
the O
amenities O
of O
Jewish O
communities O
and O
many O
Israeli O
Arabs O
have O

lands O
$ O

, O

$ O
100 O
million O
plant O
. O

and O

. O

have O

, O

have O
been O
even O
higher O
if O

had O
done O

of O

" O

. O

James B-PERSON

of O

where O

. O
" O

The O

. O

China O
copper O
stocks O

- O

. O

Lynne B-PERSON
O'Donnell E-PERSON

HONG O
KONG O
1996-08-23 O

Up O
to O
100,000 O
tonnes O
of O
copper O
held O
in O
Shanghai O
bonded O
warehouses O
, O
confounding O
the O
world O
market O
as O
to O
its O
source O
and O
ultimate O
fate O
, O
probably O
belongs O
to O
China O
's O
strategic O
state O
reserve O
, O
industry O
sources O
said O
on O
Friday O
. O

Around O
40,000 O
tonnes O
of O
the O
copper O
have O
already O
been O
moved O
to O
warehouses O
near O
the O
northern O
port O
of O
Yingkou O
, O
where O
some O
of O
the O
strategic O
stockpile O
was O
stored O
, O
they O
said O
. O

Just O
who O
owns O
the O
copper O
is O
a O
question O
that O
has O
kept O
traders O
and O
industry O
analysts O
guessing O
since O
the O
metal O
was O
channelled O
into O
Shanghai O
by O
the O
China O
National O
Nonferrous O
Metals O
Import O
and O
Export O
Corp O
( O
CNIEC O
) O
in O
June O
and O
July O
. O

It O
was O
unclear O
whether O
or O
not O
the O
40,000 O
tonnes O
had O
cleared O
customs O
-- O
which O
would O
provide O
some O
concrete O
indication O
that O
the O
strategic O
reserve O
, O
administered O
directly O
by O
the O
central O
government O
's O
State O
Planning O
Commission O
, O
owned O
the O
copper O
. O

Traders O
have O
said O
the O
reserve O
could O
negotiate O
concessions O
on O
duties O
-- O
three O
percent O
import O
tax O
and O
17 O
percent O
value-added O
tax O
-- O
that O
made O
the O
copper O
prohibitively O
expensive O
otherwise O
. O

But O
one O
source O
, O
the O
head O
of O
a O
Hong O
Kong O
trading O
house O
, O
said O
it O
made O
no O
difference O
if O
the O
copper O
was O
customs O
cleared O
or O
not O
. O

" O
If O
they O
spend O
all O
this O
money O
moving O
the O
copper O
to O
Yingkou O
, O
it O
will O
be O
sitting O
there O
for O
years O
, O
" O
he O

. O

" O

Mystery O

in O

, O
with O

unsure O

its O

in O

on O

( O

) O
. O

A O

occurs O
when O

price O
of O

is O
higher O
than O

price O
. O

CNIEC O

of O

SOCCER O
- O
DISAPPOINTING O
AJAX O
SLUMP O
2-0 O
AT O
HEERENVEEN O
. O

AMSTERDAM O
1996-08-24 O

Dutch O
champions O
Ajax O
Amsterdam O
faltered O
in O
their O
second O
league O
match O
of O
the O
season O
on O
Saturday O
losing O
2-0 O
away O
at O
Heerenveen O
. O

Ajax O
, O
who O
had O
a O
dismal O
series O
of O
pre-season O
results O
before O
beating O
NAC O
of O
Breda O
in O
their O
opening O
game O
, O
had O
the O
best O
of O
an O
entertaining O
first O
half O
but O
failed O
to O
break O
the O
deadlock O
. O

Eight O
minutes O
after O
the O
interval O
, O
Heerenveen O
's O
Romeo B-PERSON
Wouden E-PERSON
broke O
through O
the O
Amsterdam O
defence O
, O
left O
defender O
John B-PERSON
Veldman E-PERSON
standing O
and O
curled O
the O
ball O
beyond O
goalkeeper O
Edwin B-PERSON
van I-PERSON
der I-PERSON
Sar E-PERSON
into O
the O
Ajax O
net O
. O

Ajax O
, O
without O
injured O
defenders O
Marcio B-PERSON
Santos E-PERSON
and O
Winston B-PERSON
Bogarde E-PERSON
and O
strikers O
Jari B-PERSON
Litmanen E-PERSON
and O
Marc B-PERSON
Overmars E-PERSON
, O
then O
stepped O
up O
the O
pace O
and O
looked O
certain O
to O
equalise O
. O

But O
they O
left O
gaps O
at O
the O
back O
and O
on O
73 O
minutes O
Danish O
striker O
Jon B-PERSON
Dahl I-PERSON
Tomasson E-PERSON
rushed O
out O
of O
his O
own O
half O
, O
beat O
the O
Ajax O
defence O
and O
lobbed O
van B-PERSON
der I-PERSON
Sar E-PERSON
. O

The O
defeat O
means O
Ajax O
's O
main O
title O
contenders O
PSV O
Eindhoven O
, O
who O
beat O
the O
champions O
3-0 O
in O
the O
traditional O
league O
curtain-raiser O
, O
can O
go O
three O
points O
clear O
of O
their O
rivals O
if O
they O
beat O
Groningen O
on O
Sunday O
. O

British O
hostage O
in O
Chechnya O
describes O
ordeal O
. O

LONDON O
1996-08-24 O

A O
British O
aid O
worker O
, O
held O
hostage O
in O
Chechnya O
for O
nearly O
four O
weeks O
, O
said O
on O
Saturday O
a O
cocked O
Kalashnikov O
had O
been O
thrust O
into O
his O
mouth O
at O
one O
point O
during O
his O
ordeal O
. O

Michael B-PERSON
Penrose E-PERSON
, O
a O
23-year-old O
worker O
with O
the O
group O
Action O
Against O
Hunger O
, O
described O
his O
ordeal O
to O
a O
news O
conference O
when O
he O
arrived O
back O
in O
Britain O
from O
Moscow O
. O

" O
The O
worst O
period O
of O
physical O
manhandling O
was O
during O
that O
time O
when O
we O
were O
beaten O
with O
Kalashnikovs O
and O
at O
one O
point O
I O
had O
a O
Kalashnikov O
held O
to O
the O
back O
of O
my O
throat O
-- O
cocked O
, O
" O
he O
said O
. O

" O
For O
the O
first O
period O
we O
were O
held O
in O
a O
small O
room O
with O
no O
bed O
or O
anything O
. O

We O
had O
very O
little O
food O
and O
sometimes O
went O
two O
or O
three O
days O
without O
eating O
. O
" O

Gunmen O
seized O
Penrose S-PERSON
, O
who O
comes O
from O
Swerford O
in O
southern O
England O
, O
Frenchman O
Frederic B-PERSON
Malardeau E-PERSON
and O
six O
other O
hostages O
from O
their O
car O
in O
Grozny O
, O
the O
capital O
of O
Chechnya O
, O
on O
July O
27 O
. O

The O
assailants O
had O
demanded O
a O
ransom O
of O
300,000 O
pounds O
( O
$ O
465,000 O
) O
but O
no O
money O
was O
paid O
by O
the O
charity O
when O
they O
were O
released O
on O
Wednesday O
. O

The O
hostages O
were O
held O
in O
a O
house O
in O
or O
near O
Grozny O
which O
was O
bombarded O
regularly O
. O

" O
During O
the O
last O
15 O
days O
of O
being O
held O
, O
the O
fighting O
in O
Grozny O
was O
very O
close O
. O

At O
first O
it O
was O
street O
fighting O
outside O
the O
house O
and O
then O
we O
came O
under O
very O
heavy O
shelling O
and O
bombardment O
from O
conventional O
weapons O
like O
tanks O
, O
artillery O
and O
grenade O
launchers O
, O
" O
he O
said O
. O

Penrose S-PERSON
had O
been O
working O
for O
the O
charity O
which O
provides O
food O
to O
civilians O
for O
only O
a O
few O
weeks O
before O
he O
was O
captured O
. O

When O
asked O
if O
he O
would O
return O
to O
the O
mountainous O
region O
where O
rebels O
have O
been O
fighting O
Russian O
troops O
for O
full O
independence O
, O
Penrose S-PERSON
said O
: O
" O
Not O
for O
the O
time O
being O
. O

I O
do O
n't O
think O
it O
's O
safe O
for O
me O
. O

But O
maybe O
in O
the O
future O
, O
depending O
on O
the O
circumstances O
. O
" O

Princess O
Diana S-PERSON
send O
message O
to O
Mother B-PERSON
Teresa E-PERSON
. O

LONDON O
1996-08-24 O

Britain O
's O
Princess O
Diana S-PERSON
has O
sent O
a O
message O
to O
seriously O
ill O
Mother B-PERSON
Teresa E-PERSON
, O
the O
nun O
to O
whom O
she O
has O
turned O
several O
times O
for O
spiritual O
guidance O
. O

Diana S-PERSON
's O
office O
said O
on O
Saturday O
the O
princess O
had O
sent O
a O
message O
to O
the O
Nobel O
Peace O
Prize-winning O
missionary O
as O
news O
broke O
this O
week O
of O
her O
battle O
against O
heart O
problems O
and O
malaria O
. O

A O
spokeswoman O
declined O
to O
release O
details O
of O
the O
message O
. O

Diana S-PERSON
first O
met O
the O
Albanian-born O
missionary O
in O
Rome O
in O
1992 O
. O

She O
said O
afterwards O
that O
the O
meeting O
had O
fulfilled O
her O
" O
dearest O
wish O
" O
and O
the O
two O
women O
have O
met O
several O
times O
since O
. O

The O
princess O
, O
who O
has O
carved O
out O
a O
major O
role O
for O
herself O
as O
a O
helper O
of O
the O
sick O
and O
needy O
, O
is O
said O
to O
have O
turned O
to O
Mother B-PERSON
Teresa E-PERSON
for O
guidance O
as O
her O
marriage O
crumbled O
to O
heir O
to O
the O
British O
throne O
Prince B-PERSON
Charles E-PERSON
. O

The O
85-year-old O
nun O
said O
in O
the O
past O
that O
she O
was O
praying O
for O
the O
couple O
, O
whose O
divorce O
is O
expected O
to O
become O
final O
next O
week O
. O

Doctors O
caring O
for O
Mother B-PERSON

in O

hospital O
said O
on O
Saturday O
that O
her O

had O

and O
her O

was O

but O
she O

on O

in O
intensive O
care O
. O

-DOCSTART- -X- -X- O

Adventurers O
start O
Canadian O
wilderness O
race O
. O

PEMBERTON O
, O
British O
Columbia O
1996-08-24 O

About O
350 O
adventurers O
from O
nine O
countries O
set O
out O
on O
Saturday O
to O
climb O
, O
raft O
, O
bike O
and O
run O
in O
a O
323-mile O
( O
517-km O
) O
endurance O
race O
through O
the O
Canadian O
wilderness O
. O

The O
event O
, O
called O
the O
Eco-Challenge O
, O
is O
part O
of O
a O
growing O
sport O
known O
as O
adventure O
racing O
in O
which O
competitors O
test O
their O
limits O
for O
days O
over O
a O
perilous O
wilderness O
course O
. O

" O
I O
'm O
looking O
forward O
to O
this O
race O
. O

I O
think O
it O
will O
be O
more O
physically O
challenging O
and O
we O
'll O
have O
to O
go O
up O
against O
more O
diverse O
situations O
due O
to O
the O
terrain O
, O
" O
said O
Dr. O
Michael B-PERSON
Stroud E-PERSON
, O
a O
veteran O
Eco-Challenge O
participant O
. O

The O
Eco-Challenge O
has O
been O
staged O
twice O
before O
-- O
in O
Utah O
and O
Maine O
last O
year O
-- O
and O
is O
modelled O
on O
similar O
races O
overseas O
. O

The O
70 O
teams O
in O
this O
year O
's O
race O
will O
will O
trek O
glaciers O
, O
climb O
mountains O
, O
whitewater O
raft O
, O
horseback O
ride O
, O
canoe O
and O
mountain O
bike O
along O
the O
grueling O
course O
. O

This O
year O
's O
race O
, O
the O
route O
of O
which O
was O
keep O
a O
secret O
until O
Friday O
evening O
, O
is O
being O
held O
near O
Pemberton O
, O
British O
Columbia O
, O
about O
100 O
miles O
( O
160 O
km O
) O
northeast O
of O
Vancouver O
. O

The O
area O
is O
filled O
with O
treacherous O
mountain O
peaks O
, O
ice O
fields O
and O
frigid O
waters O
. O

Organisers O
expect O
about O
two-thirds O
of O
the O
participants O
to O
drop O
out O
or O
be O
disqualified O
before O
the O
finish O
. O

The O
hardy O
ones O
are O
expected O
to O
complete O
the O
course O
in O
about O
six O
days O
, O
with O
first-place O
finishers O
receiving O
$ O
10,000 O
in O
prize O
money O
. O

In O
the O
Eco-Challenge O
, O
competitors O
race O
in O
teams O
of O
five O
which O
must O
include O
both O
men O
and O
women O
. O

Team O
members O
must O
remain O
within O
100 O
yards O
( O
metres O
) O
of O
each O
other O
at O
all O
times O

Java O
is O
a O
computer O
programming O
language O
introduced O
by O
Sun O
Microsystems O
in O
mid-1995 O
which O
has O
immediately O
captured O
the O
attention O
of O
the O
industry O
for O
its O
ability O
to O
operate O
across O
virtually O
all O
computer O

in O

secure O

. O

Just O
last O
week O
, O

and O
the O

capital O
giant O
Kleiner O

million O

. O

Java O
has O

50 O

, O
ranging O
from O
Microsoft O
Corp. O
and O
International O
Business O

. O

Prasad B-PERSON
Wagle E-PERSON
, O

using O

to O

. O

One O

of O

Java O
language O
is O
that O
small O
software O
programmes O
, O
known O
as O
" O
applets O
" O
because O
they O
are O
small O
applications O
, O
can O
be O
downloaded O
from O
the O
server O

at O
the O
centre O
of O
networks O
onto O
individual O
computers O
for O
use O
. O

In O
this O
model O
, O
individual O
computer O
users O
can O
always O
gain O
access O
to O
the O
latest O
programmes O
and O
do O
not O
need O
to O
store O
more O
software O
than O
they O
are O
currently O
using O
on O

computers O
at O
any O
one O
time O
, O
also O
saving O
costs O
of O
memory O
and O
storage O
. O

SUPERBIKE O
RACES O
. O

SUGO O
, O
Japan O
1996-08-25 O

Teenager O
Yuuichi B-PERSON
Takeda E-PERSON
, O

in O
only O
his O
first O
season O
, O

the O

names O
to O

the O

nine O
of O
the O
world O
superbike O
championship O
on O
Sunday O
. O

, O
18 O
, O
showed O

far O
beyond O
his O
years O
to O
overtake O
Australian O
Ducati O
rider O
Troy B-PERSON
Corser E-PERSON
, O
last O
year O
's O
championship O
runner-up O
, O
with O
four O
of O
the O
25 O
laps O
left O
. O

Honda O
's O
Takeda S-PERSON
was O
pursued O
past O
Corser S-PERSON
by O

of O
Noriyuki B-PERSON
Haga E-PERSON
and O
Wataru B-PERSON

briefly O

in O

on O
the O
last O

. O

found O
one O
more O

of O
power O
to O
just O
take O
the O
flag O
first O
with O

. O

had O
the O

of O

the O

lap O
at O

kph O
. O

, O

during O

in O
fourth O

seconds O
behind O

with O

of O
New O
Zealand O
11 O
seconds O

the O
winner O
. O

, O

again O

strongly O
until O
the O

from O
the O
end O
when O
he O
crashed O
while O

to O

winner O
Takuma B-PERSON
Aoki E-PERSON
. O

, O

. O

, O

of O

, O

by O

CRICKET O
- O
POLLOCK S-PERSON
CONCLUDES O
WARWICKSHIRE O
CAREER O
WITH O
FLOURISH O
. O

LONDON O
1996-08-25 O

South O
African O
fast O
bowler O
Shaun B-PERSON
Pollock E-PERSON
concluded O
his O
Warwickshire O
career O
with O
a O
flourish O
on O
Sunday O
by O
taking O
the O
final O
three O
wickets O
during O
the O
county O
's O
Sunday O
league O
victory O
over O
Worcestershire O
. O

Pollock S-PERSON
, O
who O
returns O
home O
on O
Tuesday O
for O
an O
ankle O
operation O
, O
took O
the O
last O
three O
wickets O
in O
nine O
balls O
as O
Worcestershire O
were O
dismissed O
for O
154 O
. O

After O
an O
hour O
's O
interruption O
for O
rain O
, O
Warwickshire O
then O
reached O
an O
adjusted O
target O
of O
109 O
with O
13 O
balls O
to O
spare O
and O
record O
their O
fifth O
win O
in O
the O
last O
six O
games O
. O

Warwickshire O
are O
currently O
in O
fourth O
position O
behind O
Yorkshire O
, O
Nottinghamshire O
and O
Surrey O
. O

Yorkshire O
captain O
David B-PERSON
Byas E-PERSON
completed O
his O
third O
Sunday O
league O
century O
as O
his O
side O
swept O
clear O
at O
the O
top O
of O
the O
table O
, O
reaching O
a O
career O
best O
111 O
not O
out O
against O
Lancashire O
. O

Lancashire O
's O
total O
of O
205 O
for O
eight O
from O
40 O
overs O
looked O
reasonable O
before O
Byas S-PERSON
put O
their O
attack O
to O
the O
sword O
, O
collecting O
his O
runs O
from O
just O
100 O
balls O
with O
three O
sixes O
and O
nine O
fours O
. O

Yorkshire O
eventually O
reached O
their O
target O
with O
only O
four O
wickets O
down O
and O
7.5 O
overs O
to O
spare O
. O

SOCCER O
- O
HINCHCLIFFE S-PERSON
CALLED O
INTO O
ENGLAND O
SQUAD O
. O

LONDON O
1996-08-25 O

England O
manager O
Glenn B-PERSON
Hoddle E-PERSON
called O
up O
uncapped O
Everton O
defender O
Andy B-PERSON
Hinchcliffe E-PERSON
on O
Sunday O
to O
the O
national O

for O

opening O

Cup O
qualifier O
against O
Moldova O
next O
weekend O
. O

Left-back O
Hinchcliffe S-PERSON
, O
27 O
, O

Tottenham O
's O
Darren B-PERSON
Anderton E-PERSON
who O
has O
a O

CRICKET O
- O
RUN-OUT O
GIVES O
LEWIS S-PERSON
AND O
ENGLAND O
SLIM O
SATISFACTION O
. O

LONDON O
1996-08-25 O

Chris B-PERSON
Lewis E-PERSON
did O
his O
best O
to O
forget O
his O
controversial O
omission O
from O
the O
England O
one-day O
squad O
on O
Sunday O
but O
could O
not O
prevent O
Pakistan O
reasserting O
their O
dominance O
in O
the O
final O
test O
at O
The O
Oval O
. O

A O
super O
piece O
of O
fielding O
by O
Lewis S-PERSON
, O
dropped O
as O
a O
disciplinary O
measure O
after O
arriving O
only O
35 O
minutes O
before O
the O
start O
on O
the O
fourth O
morning O
, O
provided O
the O
only O
bright O
spot O
for O
England O
as O
the O
touring O
team O
batted O
on O
to O
reach O
413 O
for O
five O
at O
the O
interval O
, O
a O
lead O
of O
87 O
. O

The O
solitary O
wicket O
to O
fall O
was O
Asif B-PERSON
Mujtaba E-PERSON
, O
run O
out O
for O
13 O
attempting O
a O
second O
run O
to O
third O
man O
where O
Lewis S-PERSON
was O
lurking O
with O
a O
point O
to O
prove O
. O

There O
seemed O
scant O
danger O
until O
the O
Surrey O
player O
swooped O
on O
to O
the O
ball O
and O
returned O
off O
balance O
to O
county O
team O
mate O
Alec B-PERSON
Stewart E-PERSON
who O
whipped O
off O
the O
bails O
. O

Lewis S-PERSON
, O
though O
, O
could O
not O
make O
similar O
waves O
with O
the O
ball O
as O
Salim B-PERSON
Malik E-PERSON
and O
Wasim B-PERSON
Akram E-PERSON
batted O
through O
the O
rest O
of O
the O
session O
with O
few O
alarms O
. O

Wasim S-PERSON
rattled O
along O
to O
30 O
not O
out O
, O
outscoring O
his O
partner O
who O
was O
unbeaten O
on O
24 O
at O
the O
break O
, O
although O
the O
weather O
was O
again O
threatening O
to O
play O
the O
dominant O
role O
. O

Rain O
arrived O
just O
as O
the O
players O
left O
the O
field O
for O
lunch O
, O
forcing O
the O
ground-staff O
into O
action O
yet O
again O
. O

The O
weather O
delayed O
the O
resumption O
for O
over O
an O
hour O
, O
the O
umpires O
finally O
announcing O
play O
would O
start O
again O
at O
1445 O
local O
time O
( O
1345 O
GMT O
) O
. O

SOCCER O
- O
FIORENTINA O
WIN O
WITH O
BATISTUTA S-PERSON
DOUBLE O
. O

MILAN O
1996-08-25 O

Argentine O
striker O
Gabriel B-PERSON
Batistuta E-PERSON
gave O
Fiorentina O
the O
perfect O
70th O
birthday O
present O
on O
Sunday O
with O
two O
goals O
that O
gave O
the O
Italian O
Cup O
winners O
a O
2-1 O
Supercup O
victory O
over O
serie O
A O
champions O
Milan O
. O

The O
victory O
, O
coming O
on O
the O
eve O
of O
the O
founding O
of O
the O
Florence O
club O
in O
1926 O
, O
also O
marked O
the O
first O
time O
since O
the O
pre-season O
trophy O
between O
the O
Cup O
winners O
and O
league O
champions O
was O
started O
in O
1988 O
that O
the O
Cup O
winners O
had O
won O
. O

Batistuta S-PERSON
gave O
Fiorentina O
the O
lead O
in O
the O
11th O
minute O
. O

Sweden O
's O
Stefan B-PERSON
Schwarz E-PERSON
picked O
him O
out O
with O
a O
lob O
to O
the O
edge O
of O
the O
box O
and O
Batistuta S-PERSON
did O
the O
rest O
, O
chipping O
veteran O
defender O
Franco B-PERSON
Baresi E-PERSON
and O
scoring O
at O
the O
near O
post O
. O

Montenegrin O
midfielder O
Dejan B-PERSON
Savicevic E-PERSON
equalised O
for O
the O
home O
team O
, O
weaving O
past O
a O
defender O
, O
checking O
and O
firing O
in O
a O
left-footed O
shot O
in O
the O
21st O
minute O
that O
gave O
young O
Fiorentina O
goalkeeper O
Francesco B-PERSON
Toldo E-PERSON
little O
chance O
. O

The O
scored O
stayed O
level O
to O
the O
final O
minutes O
but O
with O
a O
penalty O
shoot O
out O
looming O
, O
Batistuta S-PERSON
took O
charge O
. O

French O
international O
midfielder O
Marcel B-PERSON
Desailly E-PERSON
fouled O
the O
Argentine O
, O
whose O
coach O
at O
Boca O
Juniors O
before O
he O
joined O
Fiorentina O
in O
1991 O
was O
new O

Oscar B-PERSON
Tabarez E-PERSON
, O
and O

rammed O
home O
the O
free O
kick O
from O
30 O
metres O
out O
. O

The O
83rd O
minute O
shot O
, O
curling O
over O
the O
defence O
and O
dipping O
in O
under O
the O
bar O
from O
the O

dubbed O

by O

Fiorentina O
fans O

was O

reward O
for O
Fiorentina O
who O
looked O
a O
far O
more O

. O

's O
player O
of O
the O
year O

missed O
a O
good O

half O
opportunity O
but O
otherwise O
looked O
a O
little O
rusty O

team O

Baggio E-PERSON
did O
not O
play O

to O

CYCLING O
- O
FERRIGATO S-PERSON
SPRINTS O
TO O
SECOND O
STRAIGHT O
WORLD O
CUP O
WIN O
. O

ZURICH O
1996-08-25 O

Andrea B-PERSON
Ferrigato E-PERSON
of O
Italy O
sprinted O
to O
his O
second O
cycling O
World O
Cup O
win O
in O
successive O
weekends O
with O

in O

Prix O
on O

, O

of O

Sunday O

a O

Sciandri E-PERSON

a O

of O

. O

surged O
past O

Michele B-PERSON
Bartoli E-PERSON
and O
last O

of O

237km O
race O

. O

. O

- O

4-1 O
TO O

AWAY O
FROM O
AJAX O
. O

AMSTERDAM O
1996-08-25 O

Belgian O
international O
Luc B-PERSON
Nilis E-PERSON
scored O
twice O
on O
Sunday O
as O
PSV O
Eindhoven O
came O
from O
behind O
to O
beat O
Groningen O
4-1 O
in O
Eindhoven O
. O

PSV O
and O
Vitesse O
Arnhem O
are O
the O
only O
unbeaten O
teams O
after O
two O
rounds O
of O
the O
Dutch O
league O
. O

Defending O
champions O
Ajax O
Amsterdam O
were O
defeated O
2-0 O
loss O
away O
to O
Heerenveen O
on O
Saturday O
. O

Groningen O
took O
the O
lead O
in O
the O
seventh O
minute O
when O
Dean B-PERSON
Gorre E-PERSON
intercepted O
a O
back O
pass O
from O
Ernest B-PERSON
Faber E-PERSON
to O
goalkeeper O
Ronald B-PERSON
Waterreus E-PERSON
and O
shot O
home O
. O

Faber S-PERSON
made O

in O
the O

minute O
when O
he O
headed O
in O
a O
corner O
to O
score O
the O
equaliser O
. O

PSV O

in O
the O

could O
not O
score O
until O

striker O
Romano B-PERSON

was O

off O
in O
the O

. O

his O

, O

PSV O
the O

and O
in O
the O

did O
Zeljko B-PERSON

ending O
the O

only O
nine O
men O

1996-08-25 O

Blind E-PERSON
has O
decided O
to O
end O
his O
international O
career O
, O

David B-PERSON
Endt E-PERSON
said O
on O
Sunday O
. O

told O
Dutch O

agency O

that O
Blind S-PERSON
, O
35 O

no O

for O
the O
national O
squad O
. O

decided O
to O

his O

CRICKET O
- O
INDIA O
BANS O
SIDHU S-PERSON
FOR O
50 O
DAYS O
. O

NEW O
DELHI O
1996-08-25 O

Indian O
opener O
Navjot B-PERSON
Singh I-PERSON
Sidhu E-PERSON
was O
on O
Sunday O
given O
a O
50-day O
ban O
from O
international O
cricket O
for O
quitting O
this O
year O
's O
tour O
of O
England O
, O
the O
Press O
Trust O
of O
India O
said O
. O

right-handed O
batsman O
will O
have O
to O
forfeit O
half O
the O
money O
he O
was O
due O
to O

from O
the O

agency O
said O
after O
a O

set O
up O
by O

of O

for O

in O
India O
met O
at O

, O
near O
the O

city O
of O

. O

Sidhu S-PERSON
abandoned O
the O

team O
after O
the O
third O

international O
against O
England O
at O

in O

26 O
, O

began O
a O

series O
, O
citing O
serious O
differences O
with O
captain O
Mohammed B-PERSON

. O

was O
sacked O
after O
the O
tour O
and O
replaced O
by O
Sachin B-PERSON
Tendulkar E-PERSON
. O

Sidhu S-PERSON
was O
not O
considered O
for O
the O

Cup O
beginning O
in O
Sri O
Lanka O
this O
month O
and O
the O

against O
Pakistan O

to O
be O
played O
in O
Canada O
next O
month O
. O

, O
whose O
ban O
ends O
on O
October O
14 O
, O
will O
be O
free O
to O

RUGBY O
UNION O
- O
All O
Blacks O
relive O
triumph O
. O

PRETORIA O
, O
Aug O
25 O
- O
Captain O
Sean B-PERSON
Fitzpatrick E-PERSON
and O
his O
All O
Blacks O
revisited O
the O
test O
venue O
today O
to O
relive O
some O
of O
the O
magic O
moments O
of O
yesterday O
's O
momentous O
rugby O
victory O
over O
South O
Africa O
, O
NZPA O
reported O
. O

Most O
of O
the O
test O
15 O
who O
beat O
the O
Springboks O
33-26 O
to O
secure O
New O
Zealand O
's O
first-ever O
rugby O
series O
in O
South O
Africa O
stood O
in O
the O
middle O
of O
the O
empty O
50,000-seat O
Loftus O
Versfeld O
. O

Magnificent O
, O
' O
' O
said O
Fitzpatrick S-PERSON
, O
New O
Zealand O
's O
most O
capped O
player O
and O
the O
world O
's O
most O
capped O
forward O
. O

The O
players O
relived O
the O
moves O
and O
tries O
, O
the O
tackles O
and O
what O
might O
have O
been O
as O
the O
emotions O
of O
victory O
continued O
. O

Zinzan B-PERSON
Brooke E-PERSON
, O
the O
only O
No O
8 O
in O
test O
rugby O
to O
have O
scored O
a O
dropped O
goal O
when O
he O
kicked O
a O
three-pointer O
against O
England O
during O
last O
year O
's O
World O
Cup O
, O
added O
a O
second O
to O
his O
name O
yesterday O
. O

I O
was O
right O
here O
, O
' O
' O
he O
said O
standing O
at O
the O
spot O
where O
he O
had O
received O
the O
ball O
for O
the O
kick O
. O

The O
maul O
was O
there O
and O
I O
was O
going O
to O
go O
in O
but O
I O
thought O
I O
should O
hold O
off O
because O
we O
had O
the O
ball O

Moslem O
refugees O
seek O
to O

in O
Serb-held O
town O
. O

Samir B-PERSON
Arnaut E-PERSON

MATUZICI O
, O
Bosnia O
1996-08-25 O

Thousands O
of O
Moslem O
refugees O
denounced O
Bosnia O
's O
elections O
as O
a O
farce O
on O
Sunday O
because O

incomers O
would O
be O
able O
to O
vote O
in O
their O
old O
home O
town O
, O
cementing O
partition O
of O
the O
country O
. O

said O
they O
were O
ready O
to O
force O
their O

back O
across O
post-war O

lines O

Serb-held O
Doboj O
, O
one O
of O

where O

refugees O

to O

where O
they O
once O
lived O
. O

refugees O
, O

in O

on O
government O

two O
km O
from O

in O

a O

to O

, O
" O

. O

Bosnia O

and O

a O

" O

. O

a O

to O

. O

to O

the O
Serbs O
from O
their O
own O
( O
separatist O
) O
politics O
. O
" O

The O

guaranteed O

to O
return O
to O
their O
homes O

have O

. O

of O

from O

are O

from O

Corporate O
America O
taking O
new O
view O
on O
compensation O
. O

Anne B-PERSON
Murray E-PERSON

NEW O
YORK O
1996-08-23 O

Corporate O
America O
is O
planning O
major O
changes O
in O
employee O
compensation O
in O
the O
next O
few O
years O
, O
according O
to O
a O
recent O
study O
. O

What O
it O
comes O
down O
to O
is O
this O
: O
If O
you O
're O
highly O
skilled O
, O
you O
'll O
benefit O
nicely O
. O

But O
if O
you O
're O
not O
and O
cannot O
contribute O
to O
your O
employer O
's O
goals O
, O
you O
'll O
be O
paid O
less O
. O

The O
survey O
, O
conducted O
in O
late O
1995 O
and O
the O
early O
part O
of O
this O
year O
by O
management O
consulting O
firm O
Towers O
Perrin O
, O
showed O
that O
the O
focus O
will O
be O
on O
an O
employee O
's O
overall O
value O
to O
the O
company O
's O
bottom O
line O
-- O
rather O
than O
how O
well O
an O
employee O
performs O
a O
specific O
task O
. O

Presently O
, O
for O
example O
, O
if O
an O
accountant O
's O
job O
involves O
doing O
five O
specific O
tasks O
, O
he O
or O
she O
can O
expect O
a O
certain O
salary O
, O
said O
Sandra B-PERSON
O'Neal E-PERSON
, O
a O
Towers O
Perrin O
principal O
. O

In O
the O
future O
, O
the O
accountant O
will O
be O
evaluated O
solely O
on O
" O
knowledge O
, O
skill O
and O
abilities O
, O
" O
she O
said O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
using O
accounting O
skills O
, O
the O
accountant O
will O
also O
have O
to O
be O
creative O
, O
work O
well O
in O
a O
team O
, O
be O
sensitive O
to O
customer O
needs O
and O
set O
productivity O
goals O
. O

" O
The O
good O
news O
is O
, O
if O
you O
're O
highly O
skilled O
and O
have O
many O
abilities O
, O
you O
'll O
be O
paid O
more O
, O
" O
said O
O'Neal S-PERSON
. O

" O
The O
bad O
news O
is O
, O
if O
you O
're O
not O
skilled O
and O
ca O
n't O
contribute O
to O
a O
team O
, O
to O
customer O
service O
and O
the O
organisation O
's O
goals O
, O
you O
'll O
be O
paid O
less O
. O
" O

Of O
the O
750 O
mid-to-large O
size O
corporations O
surveyed O
, O
81 O
percent O
had O
undergone O
a O
major O
restructuring O
in O
the O
last O
three O
years O
, O
and O
more O
than O
two-thirds O
reported O
that O
productivity O
and O
profits O
were O
up O
as O
result O
. O

Next O
on O
the O
agenda O
for O
these O
firms O
is O
developing O
a O
new O
compensation O
structure O
, O
and O
78 O
percent O
report O
that O
they O
are O
considering O
a O
new O
, O
skills-based O
plan O
for O
both O
management O
and O
non-management O
employees O
. O

This O
coming O
shift O
, O
O'Neal S-PERSON
said O
, O
" O
is O
not O
just O
isolated O
or O
a O
fad O
. O

It O
's O
an O
inexorable O
change O
. O
" O

After O
World O
War O
II O
, O
corporations O
adopted O
a O
" O
military O
model O
" O
creating O
hierarchical O
organisations O
where O
" O
the O
concept O
of O
defined O
tasks O
worked O
great O
, O
" O
she O
said O
. O

But O
as O
the O
economy O
became O
global O
, O
customers O
were O
more O
demanding O
and O
problems O
became O
more O
complex O
. O

" O
Multi-layers O
kept O
management O
at O
a O
distance O
from O
its O
customers O
, O
" O
O'Neal S-PERSON
said O
. O

Now O
organisations O
must O
change O
to O
stay O
competitive O
. O

O'Neal S-PERSON
says O
firms O
will O
place O
a O
greater O
emphasis O
on O
teams O
and O
team O
performance O
in O
giving O
raises O
. O

If O
your O
team O
does O
well O
, O
you O
'll O
do O
well O
. O

If O
it O
does O
n't O
do O
well O
, O
do O
n't O
expect O
a O
raise O
. O

Is O
this O
fair O
to O
an O
employee O
who O
can O
go O
the O
distance O
but O
is O
on O
a O
team O
that O
ca O
n't O
keep O
up O
? O

" O
That O
's O
an O
important O
question O
we O
used O
to O
ask O
a O
lot O
, O
" O
said O
O'Neal S-PERSON
. O
" O

It O
's O
not O
a O
question O
we O
ask O
any O
more O
. O

The O
more O
important O
question O
is O
-- O
' O
Do O
we O
have O
results O
? O
' O

" O

To O
get O
those O
results O
, O
27 O
percent O
of O
the O
companies O
surveyed O
plan O
to O
eliminate O
base O
pay O
increases O
in O
favour O
of O
cash O
bonuses O
and O
incentives O
, O
such O
as O
employee O
and O
team O
award O
programmes O
and O
education O
. O

Companies O
that O
can O
change O
their O
culture O
and O
view O
employees O
as O
business O
partners O
will O
do O
well O
, O
O'Neal S-PERSON
said O
. O

For O
example O
, O
the O
survey O
rated O
some O
participants O
in O
the O
survey O
as O
" O
high-performing O
" O
companies O
, O
based O
on O
their O
return O
on O
equity O
above O
16 O
percent O
. O

Those O
companies O
also O
said O
they O
already O
offer O
employees O
variable O
pay O
and O
business O
education O
, O
give O
their O
managers O
more O
control O
over O
pay O
decisions O
and O
celebrate O
employee O
and O
team O
success O
. O

" O
They O
respect O
employees O
more O
, O
they O
trust O
employees O
more O
and O
they O
value O
their O
employees O
more O
, O
" O
O'Neal S-PERSON
said O
. O

" O
The O
key O
to O
success O
at O
high-performance O
companies O
is O
engaging O
employees O
in O
a O
business O
partnership O
. O

It O
will O
improve O
a O
company O
's O
bottom O
line O
. O
" O

largest O

item O
and O
traditionally O
grows O
better O
than O
summer O
wheat O
in O
Ukraine O
's O
soil O
. O

Further O
plans O
, O
he O
said O
, O
called O
for O
full O
provision O
of O
resources O
like O
fertiliser O
and O
herbicides O
for O
25 O
percent O
of O
Ukraine O
's O
arable O
land O
next O
year O
, O
for O
50 O
percent O
in O
1998 O
and O
100 O
percent O
of O
the O
land O
in O
1999 O
. O

" O
If O
we O
follow O
this O
we O
'll O
be O
able O
to O
sell O
10 O
million O
tonnes O
of O
grain O
by O
the O
year O
2000 O
, O
" O
Borkus S-PERSON
said O
. O

The O
government O
has O
been O
trying O
to O
phase O
out O
huge O
subsidies O
to O
the O
farm O
sector O
, O
and O
in O
a O
move O
back O
to O
pre-Soviet O
days O
has O
given O
up O
to O
50 O
hectares O
( O
124 O
acres O
) O
of O
land O
to O
some O
36,000 O
private O
farmers O
willing O
to O
go O
it O
alone O
. O

Collective O
farms O
will O
last O
for O
the O
next O
few O
years O
, O
because O
most O
private O
farms O
now O
only O
produce O

to O
feed O
themselves O
with O
maybe O
a O
little O
extra O
to O

, O

: O
" O

the O
future O
, O
maybe O
, O
but O

's O

. O

" O

. O

. O
" O

Advanced O
Medical O
buying O
IVAC O
Medical O
. O

SAN O
DIEGO O
1996-08-26 O

Advanced O
Medical O
Inc. O
said O
Monday O
it O
will O
buy O
IVAC O
Medical O
Systems O
Inc. O
, O
a O
former O
Eli O
Lilly O
& O
Co O
. O

unit O
, O
for O
about O
$ O
400 O
million O
in O
cash O
, O
creating O
one O
of O
the O
world O
's O
largest O
makers O
of O
intravenous O
infusion O
therapy O
products O
. O

Under O
the O
agreement O
, O
IVAC O
and O
Advanced O
Medical O
's O
wholly O
owned O
subsidiary O
, O
IMED O
Corp. O
, O
will O
merge O
to O
form O
a O
new O
company O
that O
will O
develop O
and O
manufacture O
infusion O
pumps O
that O
regulate O
the O
amount O
of O
intravenous O
fluid O
being O
administered O
to O
a O
patient O
, O
as O
well O
as O
proprietary O
disposable O
products O
. O

The O
combined O
company O
will O
have O
estimated O
revenues O
of O
$ O
353 O
million O
. O

Advanced O
Medical O
, O
through O
IMED O
, O
is O
already O
one O
of O
the O
nation O
's O
largest O
developers O
and O
manufacturers O
of O
intravenous O
infusion O
pumps O
and O
proprietary O
disposable O
products O
. O

It O
has O
sales O
in O
38 O
foreign O
countries O
. O

San O
Diego-based O
IVAC O
is O
a O
major O
provider O
of O
infusion O
systems O
and O
related O
technologies O
to O
the O
health-care O
industry O
. O

It O
has O
manufacturing O
plants O
in O
San O
Diego O
; O
Creedmoor O
, O
N.C. O
; O
Hampshire O
, O
England O
; O
and O
Tijuana O
, O
Mexico O
, O
and O
distributes O
its O
prodcuts O
in O
more O
than O
120 O
countries O
. O

Eli O
Lilly O
sold O
IVAC O
on O
Dec. O
31 O
, O
1994 O
to O
DLJ O
Merchant O
Banking O
Partners O
LP O
, O
River O
Medical O
Inc. O
and O
other O
investors O
. O

Advanced O
Medical O
said O
it O
expects O
to O
take O
an O
unspecified O
one-time O
charge O
to O
pay O
for O
the O
merger O
. O

It O
did O
not O
say O
when O
the O
charge O
would O
be O
taken O
. O

" O
The O
addition O
of O
IVAC O
is O
expected O
to O
contribute O
to O
financial O
results O
in O
the O
full O
second O
quarter O
of O
1997 O
, O
" O
the O
companies O
said O
. O

The O
merger O
will O
add O
to O
both O
companies O
' O
historical O
leadership O
in O
infusion O
therapy O
and O
technology-based O
drug O
delivery O
devices O
, O
they O
said O
. O

In O
1968 O
, O
IVAC O
introduced O
the O
world O
's O
first O
infusion O
therapy O
monitoring O
device O
. O

A O
year O
later O
IVAC O
improved O
its O
system O
with O
the O
addition O
of O
an O
IV O
pump O
that O
regulated O
the O
flow O
of O
liquids O
through O
positive O
pressure O
. O

IMED O
introduced O
the O
world O
's O
first O
volumetric O
infusion O
pump O
in O
1974 O
. O

IMED O
had O
profits O
of O
$ O
1.7 O
million O
, O
or O
6 O
cents O
per O
fully O
diluted O
common O
share O
, O
on O
$ O
53.9 O
million O
in O
revenues O
in O
the O
first O
half O
of O
1996 O
. O

Excluding O
the O
effect O
of O
a O
one-time O
restructuring O
charge O
of O
$ O
17.4 O
million O
, O
IVAC O
had O
net O
income O
of O
$ O
4.2 O
million O
on O
net O
sales O
of O
$ O
112.8 O
million O
for O
the O
1996 O
first O
half O
. O

Advanced O
Medical O
reported O
profits O
of O
$ O
8.4 O
million O
on O
sales O
of O
$ O
29.2 O
million O
in O
the O
quarter O
ended O
June O
30 O
. O

William B-PERSON
J. I-PERSON
Mercer E-PERSON
, O
IVAC O
president O
and O
chief O

, O
will O

. O

He O

, O

St O
Helens O

on O
Monday O

66-14 O
to O

League O
title O
. O

secured O

they O

season O

, O

Alan B-PERSON
Hunte E-PERSON

, O

, O

. O

. O

's O

RALLYING O
- O
MAKINEN S-PERSON
STEPS O
UP O
TITLE O
BID O
WITH O
LAKES O
WIN O
. O

JYVASKYLA O
, O
Finland O
1996-08-26 O

Tommi B-PERSON
Makinen E-PERSON
took O
a O
significant O
step O
towards O
becoming O
world O
rally O
champion O
with O
a O

victory O
in O
the O

Lakes O
Rally O
on O
Monday O
. O

Mitsubishi O
driver O
Makinen S-PERSON
stopped O
experienced O
fellow O
Finn O
Juha B-PERSON
Kankkunen E-PERSON
in O
his O
tracks O
on O
the O
final O
day O
of O
the O
1,452-km O
rally O
, O

lead O
on O
the O
first O

. O

" O

was O

difficult O
win O
- O
three O
days O

percent O

, O

, O
whose O

completed O

. O

Kankkunen S-PERSON
was O

in O

LEEDS O
, O

1996-08-26 O

. O

) O

in O

season O

SOCCER O
- O
SEYCHELLES O
FAIL O
IN O
BID O
FOR O
HISTORIC O
VICTORY O
. O

Mark B-PERSON
Gleeson E-PERSON

JOHANNESBURG O
1996-08-26 O

The O
tiny O
islands O
of O
the O
Seychelles O
failed O
to O
make O
soccer O
history O
at O
the O
weekend O
when O
they O
bowed O
out O
of O
the O
preliminary O
rounds O
of O
the O
African O
Nations O
Cup O
. O

Trailing O
fellow O
Indian O
Ocean O
islanders O
Mauritius O
1-0 O
from O
the O
first O
leg O
, O
they O
were O
held O
to O
a O
1-1 O
draw O
at O
home O
on O
Saturday O
despite O
playing O
against O
10 O
men O
for O
most O
of O
the O
match O
. O

The O
2-1 O
aggregate O
took O
Mauritius O
into O
the O
group O
phase O
of O
the O
qualifiers O
for O
the O
1998 O
finals O
, O
and O
kept O
up O
the O
Seychelles O
' O
record O
of O
never O
having O
won O
an O
official O
match O
in O
their O
10 O
years O
of O
FIFA O
membership O
. O

The O
Seychelles O
must O
have O
thought O
they O
were O
on O
course O
for O
a O
historic O
breakthrough O
when O
Mauritian O
midfielder O
Andre B-PERSON
Caboche E-PERSON
was O
sent O
off O
for O
a O
crude O
tackle O
in O
the O
19th O
minute O
. O

But O
the O
visitors O
responded O
to O
the O
setback O
immediately O
-- O
veteran O
striker O
Ashley B-PERSON
Mocude E-PERSON
scoring O
a O
minute O
later O
to O
give O
them O
a O
two-goal O
aggregate O
lead O
. O

Although O
Danny B-PERSON
Rose E-PERSON
's O
50th-minute O
equaliser O
gave O
the O
Seychellois O
renewed O
hope O
they O
could O
not O
find O
the O
net O
again O
and O
were O
eliminated O
. O

Mauritius O
now O
play O
in O
group O
seven O
of O
the O
qualifiers O
against O
Malawi O
, O
Mozambique O
and O
favourites O
Zambia O
. O

Namibia O
, O
who O
drew O
0-0 O
with O
Botswana O
in O

first O
leg O
, O
won O
the O
second O
leg O
in O

6-0 O

their O

run O
to O
eight O
matches O
and O
continue O
their O
remarkable O
progress O
on O
the O
African O
soccer O
stage O
. O

They O
now O
play O
in O
group O
five O
with O
Cameroon O
, O
Gabon O
and O
Kenya O
. O

striker O
Bachirou B-PERSON
Salou E-PERSON
returned O
home O
to O

to O
score O

of O
their O

Congo O
. O

, O

, O

. O

SWIMMING O
- O
POPOV S-PERSON
IN O
`SERIOUS O
CONDITION O
' O
AFTER O
STABBING O
. O

MOSCOW O
1996-08-26 O

Russian O
double O
Olympic O
swimming O
champion O
Alexander B-PERSON
Popov E-PERSON
was O
in O
a O
serious O
condition O
on O
Monday O
after O
being O
stabbed O
on O
a O
Moscow O
street O
. O

A O
doctor O
said O
it O
was O
too O
early O
to O
say O
whether O
Popov S-PERSON
, O
the O
only O
man O
to O
retain O
the O
Olympic O
50 O
and O
100 O
metres O
freestyle O
titles O
, O
would O
return O
to O
top-level O
sport O
. O

" O
His O
condition O
is O
serious O
, O
" O
said O
Rimma B-PERSON
Maslova E-PERSON
, O
deputy O
chief O
doctor O
of O
Hospital O
No O
31 O
in O
the O
Russian O
capital O
. O
" O

But O
he O
is O
conscious O
and O
is O
talking O
and O
smiling O
. O
" O

Maslova S-PERSON
told O
Reuters O
she O
was O
not O
an O
expert O
in O
sports O
medicine O
, O
but O
said O
it O
was O
too O
early O
to O
judge O
Popov S-PERSON
's O
chances O
of O
returning O
to O
competitive O
swimming O
. O

Popov S-PERSON
, O
who O
won O
gold O
in O
the O
50 O
and O
100 O
metres O
freestyle O
at O
the O
recent O
Atlanta O
Olympics O
, O
was O
stabbed O
in O
the O
abdomen O
late O
on O
Saturday O
after O
an O
argument O
with O
a O
group O
of O
roadside O
watermelon O
sellers O
in O
south-west O
Moscow O
. O

Maslova S-PERSON
said O
the O
wound O
had O
affected O
a O
lung O
and O
a O
kidney O
. O

Doctors O
operated O
on O
Popov S-PERSON
, O
24 O
, O
for O
three O
hours O
. O

Popov S-PERSON
told O
NTV O
television O
on O
Sunday O
he O
was O
in O
no O
danger O
and O
promised O
he O
would O
be O
back O
in O
the O
pool O
shortly O
. O
" O

There O
's O
no O
need O
to O
worry O
. O

We O
're O
going O
to O
be O
walking O
soon O
-- O
and O
swimming O
, O
" O
he O
insisted O
cheerfully O
from O
his O
bed O
in O
the O
intensive O
care O
unit O
. O

Interfax O
news O
agency O
said O
police O
had O
detained O
one O
of O
the O
attackers O
. O

It O
said O
the O
row O
started O
when O
Popov S-PERSON
and O
a O
group O
of O
his O
friends O
were O
returning O
from O
a O
party O
. O

Vitaly B-PERSON
Smirnov E-PERSON
, O
president O
of O
the O
Russian O
National O
Olympic O
Committee O
, O
said O
President O
Boris B-PERSON
Yeltsin E-PERSON
had O
given O
the O
swimmer O
Russia O
's O
top O
award O
for O
his O
Olympic O
performance O
. O
" O

I O
am O
not O
a O
doctor O
but O
I O
think O
he O
is O
doing O
all O
right O
, O
" O
said O
Smirnov S-PERSON
. O

Smirnov S-PERSON
said O
the O
Olympic O
Committee O
might O
ask O
the O
government O
to O
take O
measures O
to O
protect O
the O
country O
's O
best O
athletes O
, O
some O
of O

have O
already O

of O

in O

. O
