SOCCER O
- O
PLAYERS O
LEAVE O
MATCH O
EARLY O
TO O
CATCH O
PLANE O
. O

Brian B-PERSON
Homewood E-PERSON

RIO O
DE O
JANEIRO O
1996-08-26 O

Two O
key O
players O
left O
a O
Brazilian O
championship O
match O
early O
on O
Sunday O
because O
they O
had O
to O
catch O
a O
plane O
to O
Russia O
to O
play O
with O
the O
national O
team O
. O

Sao O
Paulo O
midfielder O
Andre S-PERSON
and O
Santos O
defender O
Narciso S-PERSON
were O
both O
substituted O
during O
their O
teams O
' O
game O
, O
taken O
to O
Sao O
Paulo O
airport O
and O
flown O
to O
Rio O
de O
Janeiro O
in O
a O
private O
jet O
chartered O
by O
the O
Brazilian O
Football O
Confederation O
( O
CBF O
) O
. O

At O
Rio O
, O
they O
joined O
up O
with O
the O
national O
team O
squad O
for O
the O
journey O
to O
Moscow O
, O
where O
Brazil O
will O
face O
Russia O
in O
a O
friendly O
international O
on O
Wednesday O
. O

The O
problem O
arose O
because O
the O
Sao O
Paulo-Santos O
clash O
was O
selected O
as O
the O
day O
's O
televised O
live O
match O
, O
forcing O
it O
to O
be O
put O
back O
three O
hours O
from O
the O
usual O
kickoff O
time O
. O

Santos O
suffered O
more O
from O
their O
loss O
as O
Narciso S-PERSON
's O
replacement O
Jean S-PERSON
gave O
away O
a O
penalty O
from O
which O
Sao O
Paulo O
scored O
the O
decisive O
goal O
in O
a O
2-1 O
win O
. O

Sao O
Paulo O
lead O
the O
first O
stage O
of O
the O
championship O
on O
goal O
difference O
from O
surprise O
package O
Juventude O
, O
who O
beat O
Internacional O
2-1 O
. O

Corinthians O
, O
who O
played O
in O
a O
tournament O
in O
Spain O
last O
week O
, O
also O
faced O
a O
plane O
marathon O
as O
they O
attempted O
to O
keep O
up O
with O
a O
hectic O
fixture O
list O
. O

They O
were O
due O
to O
leave O
Spain O
Monday O
night O
, O
arrive O
in O
Sao O
Paulo O
on O
Tuesday O
morning O
, O
catch O
another O
plane O
to O
the O
southern O
city O
of O
Curitiba O
one O
hour O
later O
and O
then O
play O
away O
to O
Atletico O
Paranaense O
in O
the O
Brazilian O
championship O
the O
same O
evening O
. O

Botafogo O
striker O
Tulio S-PERSON
, O
who O
was O
overlooked O
by O
Zagalo S-PERSON
for O
the O
tour O
which O
also O
features O
a O
game O
away O
to O
the O
Netherlands O
on O
Sunday O
, O
scored O
his O
third O
goal O
in O
three O
games O
as O
the O
defending O
champions O
beat O
Bahia O
2-1 O
away O
. O

Tulio S-PERSON
, O
who O
has O
been O
top-scorer O
in O
the O
competition O
for O
the O
last O
two O
seasons O
, O
has O
been O
struggling O
against O
injury O
for O
most O
of O
this O
year O
. O

7-5 O

over O

. O

Malivai B-PERSON

, O

, O

Lamonts O

plan O
. O

[ O
CORRECTED O
18:00 O
GMT O
] O

KIRKLAND O
, O
Wash O
. O

1996-08-26 O

Lamonts O
Apparel O
Inc O
, O
an O
operator O
of O
42 O
family O
apparel O
stores O
in O
six O
northwestern O
states O
, O
said O
it O
has O
filed O
a O
reorganization O
plan O
in O
bankruptcy O
court O
in O
Seattle O
. O

( O
Corrects O
to O
make O
clear O
a O
reorganization O
plan O
has O
been O
filed O
) O
. O

The O
reorganization O
plan O
calls O
for O
all O
secured O
claims O
to O
be O
paid O
in O
full O
. O

Unsecured O
claims O
, O
including O
those O
of O
company O
bondholders O
, O
will O
be O
satisfied O
by O
issuing O
new O
common O
stock O
and O
warrants O
. O

Unsecured O
claims O
are O
estimated O
at O
about O
$ O
90 O
million O
. O

Lamonts O
said O
it O
plans O
to O
issue O
9 O
million O
shares O
of O
new O
common O
stock O
. O

Of O
that O
amount O
, O
4.05 O
million O
and O
5.67 O
million O
shares O
will O
be O
allocated O
to O
the O
company O
's O
trade O
creditors O
. O

Between O
4.75 O
and O
3.13 O
million O
shares O
will O
be O
allocated O
to O
bondholders O
and O
other O
unsecured O
non-trade O
creditors O
and O
200,000 O
will O
be O
allocated O
to O
existing O
shareholders O
in O
exchange O
for O
all O
existing O
stock O
of O
the O
company O
. O

Bondholders O
and O
other O
unsecured O
non-trade O
creditors O
will O
receive O
warrants O
four O
about O
2.2 O
million O
shares O
when O
the O
company O
's O
market O
capitalization O
reaches O
$ O
20 O
million O
. O

Bondholders O
, O
other O
unsecured O
non-trade O
creditors O
, O
and O
existing O
shareholders O
also O
will O
receive O
warrants O
entitling O
them O
to O
roughly O
800,000 O
shares O
when O
the O
company O
's O
market O
capitalization O
reaches O
$ O
25 O
million O
. O

Management O
will O
receive O
options O
to O
purchase O
10 O
percent O
of O
the O
company O
's O

common O
stock O
with O

at O

exercise O

of O

million O
. O

were O

from O
a O

that O
caught O

soon O
after O

in O

's O

Islands O
, O

said O
. O

said O
the O
111 O
passengers O
and O
six O
crew O
on O
board O
the O
ferry O
Trident O
Seven O
, O
owned O
by O
France O
's O
Emeraud O
line O
, O
were O
rescued O
by O
a O

commercial O
boats O
after O
fire O
broke O
out O
in O
the O
engine O
room O
soon O
after O
it O
left O
port O
. O

woman O
was O
taken O
to O
hospital O
with O

, O

to O

. O

. O

1996-08-26 O

broke O

between O

in O

at O

Sunday O
and O
at O
least O
29 O

, O
one O
of O

groups O
said O
on O
Monday O
. O

The O
Kurdistan O
Democratic O
Party O
( O
KDP O
) O
said O

Union O
of O
Kurdistan O
( O

) O
had O
broken O
the O

between O
the O
two O
parties O
last O
week O
. O

The O
factions O
reached O
a O

on O
Friday O
after O
a O
week O
of O
fierce O
fighting O
which O
had O
put O
an O
end O
to O
a O

agreed O
a O
year O
earlier O
. O

" O
The O
PUK O
leadership O
who O
pledged O
to O
end O
fighting O
and O
cooperate O
with O
the O
latest O
U.S. O

started O
a O

against O
KDP O
positions O
, O
" O
the O

said O
in O

. O

It O
said O

fighting O
started O
at O

in O
the O

two O

, O
with O

to O

through O

in O

. O

The O

said O

were O

in O

. O

of O

on O
Monday O

on O
KDP O
positions O
near O

of O

, O

a O

some O

. O

to O

Brush O

CLEVELAND O
1996-08-26 O

Brush O
Wellman O
Inc O
said O
Monday O

10 O
of O
24 O

. O

The O
leading O

said O
in O
a O

call O

has O
traditionally O
been O

regarding O
the O
workplace O
disease O
, O
a O
lung O

which O
can O
affects O
a O
small O
percent O
of O
people O
whose O
immune O
systems O
are O

. O

14 O

industrial O

, O

Reid E-PERSON
, O

. O

. O

which O
had O
previously O
been O
made O
public O

and O

and O
annual O

. O

" O

been O

( O

" O

... O
and O

consistently O
share O

... O

. O
" O

customer O

. O

" O

than O

853 O

BRIGHT-BELGIANS O
SPEED O

'S O

. O

BRUSSELS O

Michael B-PERSON
Schumacher E-PERSON
's O
victory O
in O
the O
Belgian O
Formula O
One O
Grand O
Prix O
at O
Spa-Francorchamps O
sparked O
a O

on O

roads O
after O
the O
race O
was O
over O
. O

Belga O
news O
agency O
reported O
that O

checked O
more O
than O
3,000 O
drivers O
amd O
booked O
222 O
for O
speeding O
on O
their O
way O
home O
after O
the O
race O
. O

were O
clocked O
doing O
180 O
kilometres O
an O
hour O
( O
112 O
miles O
per O
hour O
) O
, O
Belga O
said O
. O

won O

minutes O

FEATURE O
- O
" O
Eco O
terrorists O
" O
target O
UK O
builders O
. O

Edna B-PERSON
Fernandes E-PERSON

LONDON O
1996-08-27 O

Ecological O
warfare O
has O
broken O
out O
across O
the O
British O
construction O
industry O
, O
striking O
some O
of O
the O
biggest O
corporates O
as O
activists O
give O
up O
peaceful O
protests O
and O
seek O
to O
hit O
builders O
where O
it O
hurts O
-- O
their O
profit O
margins O
. O

Described O
by O
one O
British O
company O
as O
" O
eco-terrorism O
" O
, O
it O
is O
seen O
as O
the O
new O
business O
risk O
of O
the O
1990s O
. O

Famous O
names O
like O
Tarmac O
Plc O
, O
Costain O
Group O
Plc O
and O
ARC O
, O
a O
unit O
of O
conglomerate O
Hanson O
Plc O
, O
have O
all O
been O
targeted O
. O

Activist O
groups O
are O
no O
longer O
seen O
by O
British O
firms O
as O
a O
harmless O
, O
badly O
organised O
ragbag O
of O
students O
and O

. O

" O
You O
only O
have O
to O
see O
them O
in O
action O
at O
protests O
, O
" O
said O
David B-PERSON
Harding E-PERSON
, O

at O
ARC O
, O
Hanson O
's O
aggregates O
company O
. O
" O

They O
walk O
around O

and O
camera O
equipment O
, O
they O
communicate O
and O
gather O
support O
for O
demos O
via O
the O

-- O
we O
're O
talking O
about O
a O
highly O
sophisticated O
organisation O
. O
" O

One O
road O
protestor O
under O
the O
codename O
Steady B-PERSON

told O
construction O
journal O
" O

" O
earlier O
this O

, O
" O

down O
to O

, O

to O

out O
of O

. O
" O

As O

also O

" O
terror O
" O

used O
. O

Costain O

to O

, O

runs O
through O
a O

to O

, O

, O
staff O

and O

of O

Alan B-PERSON

's O

. O

A O

: O
" O

've O

all O

of O

's O

. O

But O

when O
it O

to O

( O
employee O
) O

-- O
that O
it O
goes O

. O

Tactics O

London O

ends O

. O

LONDON O
1996-08-26 O

London O

annual O

Hill O
Carnival O
, O

largest O
in O

and O

. O

said O

. O

. O

. O

CRICKET O
- O
GOOCH S-PERSON
TO O
PLAY O
ANOTHER O
SEASON O
FOR O
ESSEX O
. O

LONDON O
1996-08-27 O

Graham B-PERSON
Gooch E-PERSON
, O
the O
43-year-old O
former O
England O
captain O
, O
is O
to O
continue O
playing O
county O
cricket O
for O
at O
least O
another O
season O
, O
his O
club O
Essex O
announced O
on O
Tuesday O
. O

Opener O
Gooch S-PERSON
's O
decision O
comes O
towards O
the O
end O
of O
a O
season O
in O
which O
he O
has O
underlined O
his O
consistency O
by O
becoming O
the O
leading O
scorer O
in O
Essex O
's O
history O
, O
beating O
Keith B-PERSON
Fletcher E-PERSON
's O
aggregate O
of O
29,434 O
. O

Gooch S-PERSON
, O
who O
retired O
from O
test O
cricket O
after O
the O
1994-95 O
tour O
of O
Australia O
but O
is O
now O
an O
England O
selector O
, O
is O
seventh O
in O
this O
season O
's O
first-class O
averages O
with O
1,429 O
runs O
at O
64.95 O
, O
having O
hit O
five O
centuries O
and O
one O
double O
century O
. O

Essex O
secretary-general O
manager O
Peter B-PERSON
Edwards E-PERSON
said O
: O
" O
He O
is O
a O
remarkable O
batsman O
and O
still O
the O
best O
in O
this O
country O
. O

No-one O
will O
argue O
with O
that O
. O

You O
just O
have O
to O
look O
at O
his O
record O
to O
appreciate O
that O
fact O
. O
" O

SOCCER O
- O
ROMANIA O

BANNED O

. O

BUCHAREST O
1996-08-27 O

Romanian O
Soccer O
Federation O
has O
banned O
first O
division O
club O
Jiul O
Petrosani O
's O
president O
Miron B-PERSON
Cozma E-PERSON
for O
two O
years O
for O

a O

team O
player O
, O
a O
federation O
statement O
said O
. O

Romania O
's O
soccer O
bosses O
also O
fined O
Cozma S-PERSON
, O
a O
well-known O

. O

who O

. O

, O

10,000 O
Swiss O

( O

8,400 O
) O
, O

with O

's O

. O

in O

. O

, O

( O
$ O

) O

" O

" O

" O

" O

- O
BUGNO S-PERSON
CLEARED O
OF O
DOPING O
. O

MILAN O
1996-08-27 O

Veteran O
Italian O
Gianni B-PERSON
Bugno E-PERSON
has O
been O
cleared O
of O
doping O
after O
testing O
positive O
for O
high O
levels O
of O
testosterone O
during O
the O
Tour O
of O
Switzerland O
in O
June O
, O
the O
Italian O
cycling O
federation O
said O
on O
Tuesday O
. O

" O
He O
has O
been O
cleared O
. O

The O
case O
is O
closed O
, O
" O
a O
spokesman O
said O
. O

Bugno S-PERSON
tested O
positive O
for O
the O
banned O
hormone O
after O
the O
fifth O
stage O
of O
the O
Tour O
, O
in O
which O
he O
finished O
third O
overall O
. O

But O
the O
spokesman O
said O
subsequent O
tests O
in O
Cologne O
proved O
his O
body O
produced O
higher-than-average O
testosterone O
levels O
naturally O
. O

Bugno S-PERSON
, O
who O
won O
the O
Giro O
d'Italia O
in O
1990 O
and O
two O
successive O
world O
titles O
, O
was O
banned O
for O
three O
months O
in O
1994 O
after O
testing O
positive O
for O
the O
stimulant O
caffeine O
. O

Expectations O
that O

S.A. O
, O

bourse O
's O
first O

listing O
, O
will O

have O
depressed O
the O

below O
its O

price O
, O
but O

expect O

in O

long O

. O

" O

half O
of O
the O
year O

to O

/ O

. O

... O

PRETORIA O

killer O
Eugene B-PERSON
de I-PERSON

of O

daily O

. O

said O

administration O
of O
Banespa O
ends O
in O
December O
30 O
and O
after O
that O

has O
to O
be O
liquidated O
or O
turned O
into O
a O

bank O
since O
there O

no O

to O

to O

government O
. O

A O

said O
he O
could O
not O
confirm O
or O

the O
report O
. O

Banespa O
has O
been O
under O
central O
bank O
special O
temporary O
administration O
since O
December O
1994 O
. O

The O
central O
bank O
management O
could O
be O
lifted O
if O
Sao O
Paulo O
state O
decided O
to O
take O
part O
in O
the O
recent O
federal O
government O
's O
plan O
to O
restructure O
state O
banks O
. O

Under O
the O
plan O
, O
the O
federal O
government O
would O
provide O
100 O
percent O
of O
the O
financing O
needed O
to O
restructure O
debt O
of O
state O
banks O
being O
privatized O
, O
liquidated O
or O
turned O
into O
development O
banks O
. O

It O
also O
offers O
to O
refinance O
up O
to O
50 O
percent O
of O
the O
debt O
held O
by O
state O
banks O
whose O
governments O
decide O
to O
keep O
control O
of O
their O
banks O
. O

Although O

plan O
was O
designed O
under O
terms O
proposed O
by O
Sao O
Paulo O
state O
governor O
Mario B-PERSON
Covas E-PERSON
, O
he O
has O
showed O
no O
interest O
in O
taking O
part O
in O
the O
plan O
because O
Sao O
Paulo O
's O
debt O
with O
Banespa O
has O
increased O
sharply O
, O
O O
Globo O
said O
. O

Sao O
Paulo O
state O
's O

Former O

Alejandro B-PERSON
Lanusse E-PERSON

. O

BUENOS O
AIRES O
1996-08-26 O

Alejandro B-PERSON
Lanusse E-PERSON
, O
the O
former O
dictator O
who O
ruled O
Argentina O
for O
two O
years O
, O
died O
at O
age O
78 O
on O
Monday O
. O

Lanusse S-PERSON
died O
after O
being O
brought O
to O
a O

a O
week O
ago O
following O
a O
fall O
at O
home O
that O
resulted O
in O
a O
blood O
clot O
in O
the O
brain O
. O

He O
was O
operated O
on O
earlier O
in O
the O
week O
but O
failed O
to O
recover O
from O
surgery O
. O

The O
former O
dictator O
, O
who O
ruled O
from O
1971 O
to O
1973 O
, O
was O
best O
known O
for O
allowing O
Juan B-PERSON
Domingo I-PERSON
Peron E-PERSON
, O
Argentina O
's O
famed O
populist O
leader O
, O
to O
return O
to O
Argentina O
after O
17 O
years O
of O
forced O
exile O
. O

Lanusse S-PERSON
took O
over O
the O
leadership O
of O
the O
country O
after O
five O
years O
of O
dictatorship O
. O

But O
unlike O
his O
two O
predecessors O
, O
Juan B-PERSON
Carlos E-PERSON
Ongania O
and O
Marcelo B-PERSON
Levingston E-PERSON
, O
who O
ruled O
Argentina O
with O
an O
iron O
hand O
, O
Lanusse S-PERSON
steered O
the O
country O
toward O
democracy O
. O

That O
resulted O
in O
general O
elections O
in O
March O
1973 O
when O
the O
Peronists O
led O
by O
Hector B-PERSON
Campora E-PERSON
and O
Vicente B-PERSON
Solano I-PERSON
Lima E-PERSON
returned O
to O
power O
. O

Lanusse S-PERSON
was O
a O
candidate O
in O
the O
election O
but O
failed O
to O
defeat O
his O
old O
adversories O
and O
never O
returned O
to O
public O
office O
. O

He O
was O
imprisoned O
for O
four O
years O
in O
1951 O
for O
taking O
part O
in O
a O
coup O
attempt O
to O
overthrow O
Peron S-PERSON
led O
by O
General O
Benjamin B-PERSON

. O

Lanusse S-PERSON
's O
rule O
saw O
the O
gradual O
rise O
of O
left-wing O
activism O
which O
culminated O
in O
another O
period O
of O
brutal O
Argentine O
dictatorship O
from O
1976 O
to O
1983 O
, O
during O

the O
military O
launched O
its O
" O
dirty O
war O
" O
that O
resulted O
in O
10,000 O
missing O
people O
. O

In O

" O

. O
" O

1996-08-27 O

Millfeed O
supplies O
for O
prompt O

remained O
tight O
and O
prices O
continued O
to O
move O
higher O
, O
millfeed O
dealers O
said O
. O

High-priced O
corn O
and O
increased O
demand O
for O
livestock O
feed O
continued O
to O
support O
millfeed O
prices O
in O
nearly O
all O
sectors O
. O

mills O
sold O
much O
of O
their O
production O
through O
September O
leaving O
little O
available O
for O
prompt O
shipment O
. O

Portland O
sources O
said O
feed O
mixer O
demand O
was O
keeping O
pace O
with O
millfeed O
production O
and O
driving O
prices O
higher O
. O

Portland O
sources O
said O
with O
corn O
priced O
there O
at O
$ O
200 O
per O
ton O
and O
barley O
at O
$ O
140 O
, O
the O
millfeeds O
at O
$ O
125 O
represent O
a O
good O
value O
. O

the O
southeast O
U.S. O
, O
dealers O
said O
feed O
mixers O
continued O
to O
be O
steady O
buyers O
with O
demand O
increasing O
for O
October O
to O
March O
positions O
. O

market O
was O

at O

per O

bid O
and O

118 O
offered O
. O

KATHMANDU O
1996-08-27 O

Nepal O
's O
centre-right O
coalition O
government O
has O
offered O
to O
meet O
the O
country O
's O
hardline O
Maoist O
communists O
for O
talks O
in O
a O

to O
end O
an O
insurgency O
in O
Nepal O
's O
western O
districts O
, O
officials O
said O
on O
Tuesday O
. O

The O
Maoists O
oppose O
multi-party O
democracy O
and O
want O
to O
establish O
a O
communist O
state O
. O

But O
the O

government O
said O
the O

must O

up O

before O

with O
them O
. O

" O

( O
the O
insurgents O
) O
should O
first O
give O
up O
their O
violent O
activities O
, O
" O
Home O
( O
Interior O
) O
Minister O
Khum B-PERSON
Bahadur I-PERSON
Khadga E-PERSON
said O
. O

About O
54 O
people O
have O
died O
in O
Maoist O
insurgent O
activity O
and O
in O
police O
action O
against O
them O
since O
February O
, O
officials O
said O
. O

opposition O
parties O
have O
accused O
the O
police O
of O
having O
killed O
more O
people O
than O
the O
insurgents O
. O

Some O
human O
rights O
groups O
have O
criticised O
the O
government O
's O

of O
the O
situation O
. O

In O

on O

, O

to O
" O

's O

" O
and O
win O
election O
to O

. O

On O
Monday O
, O

had O

to O

to O

of O

People O
's O
Front O
Nepal O
( O
Bhattarai O
) O
, O

faction O
which O
leads O
the O
insurgency O
. O

" O

government O
is O
ready O
to O

of O
the O

representatives O
who O
want O
to O

in O

, O
" O

said O
. O

A O

was O
set O
up O
in O

six O
years O
ago O
, O

on O

. O

. O

killed O

and O

three O

after O

on O
Tuesday O
. O

told O

a O

of O

Workers O
Party O
( O
PKK O
) O
guerrillas O
stopped O
the O
buses O
at O
a O

on O

road O
linking O
the O
eastern O
provinces O
of O
Erzincan O
and O
Sivas O
on O
Monday O
night O
and O
forced O
the O
passengers O
to O
get O
out O
. O

The O
rebels O
killed O
one O
of O

drivers O
and O
a O
passenger O
after O
checking O
the O
identities O
of O
the O
passengers O
, O
they O
said O
. O

officials O
said O
the O
rebels O
set O
ablaze O
two O
buses O
and O
released O
all O
but O
three O
passengers O
. O

More O
than O
20,000 O
people O
have O
been O
killed O
in O
the O

conflict O
between O

troops O
and O
PKK O
guerrillas O
fighting O
for O

from O

. O

310 O

, O

. O

. O

was O
tight O

, O

about O
30 O
miles O
( O
50 O
km O
) O

of O

. O

in O

. O

. O

. O

1996-08-27 O

China O

for O

blocked O

" O

" O

( O

) O

, O

. O

New O

's O

, O

on O

, O

. O

has O

to O

of O

. O

" O

would O

in O

. O

structure O
in O
Jerusalem O
's O
Old O
City O
they O
said O
had O
been O
built O
with O

from O
the O
Palestinian O

Authority O
for O
use O
as O
a O
social O
club O
. O

used O
a O

to O
lift O

over O
the O
Old O
City O
's O
walls O
to O
reach O
the O
building O
amidst O
narrow O

, O

said O
. O

at O
the O

said O
work O
had O

on O
the O
building O
in O
1991 O
and O
it O
had O
yet O
to O
be O
completed O
when O
the O

police O
bulldozed O
it O
. O

The O
Palestinian O
Authority O
was O
set O
up O
under O
the O
1993 O

deal O
. O

" O

been O
a O

for O

between O
one O
( O
1000 O
GMT O
) O

, O
" O

Ahmed B-PERSON

" O

a O

has O

on O

and O

want O

to O

where O
they O

the O

. O
" O

Prime O
Minister O
Benjamin B-PERSON

's O

, O

. O

said O

had O

They O

of O

. O

SEC O
adopts O
rules O
to O
improve O
investor O
access O
to O
best O
stock O
prices O
. O

WASHINGTON O
1996-08-28 O

The O
Securities O
and O
Exchange O
Commission O
Wednesday O
approved O
rules O
designed O
to O
give O
stock O
market O
investors O
a O
better O
chance O
at O
getting O
the O
best O
price O
available O
for O
their O
orders O
. O

The O
so-called O
order O
handling O
rules O
, O
which O
were O
proposed O
last O
September O
, O
were O
approved O
in O
a O
4-0 O
vote O
. O

The O
new O
rules O
will O
require O
specialists O
at O
stock O
exchanges O
and O
market O
makers O
on O
Nasdaq O
to O
allow O
customers O
to O
view O
price O
quotes O
from O
other O
electronic O
trading O
systems O
that O
may O
not O
be O
readily O
available O
to O
them O
. O

The O
rules O
will O
also O
require O
that O
customer O
limit O
orders O
be O
displayed O
with O
prices O
better O
than O
those O
available O
in O
quotes O
publicly O
available O
at O
the O
time O
. O

Specialists O
and O
market O
makers O
are O
companies O
or O
individuals O
recognised O
as O
qualified O
to O
maintain O
an O
orderly O
market O
in O
a O
stock O
. O

In O
a O
limit O
order O
, O
investors O
specify O
the O
price O
at O
which O
they O
are O
willing O
to O
buy O
or O
sell O
, O
as O
opposed O
to O
a O
market O
order O
executed O
at O
prevailing O
prices O
. O

" O
These O
rules O
are O
intended O
to O
empower O
all O
investors O
, O
by O
allowing O
their O
orders O
to O
compete O
on O
a O
level O
playing O
field O
, O
and O
by O
providing O
the O
disclosure O
they O
need O
to O
make O
informed O
decisions O
, O
" O
said O
SEC O
Chairman O
Arthur B-PERSON
Levitt E-PERSON
. O

The O
SEC O
's O
goal O
, O
he O
added O
, O
was O
to O
create O
" O
one O
system O
where O
one O
price O
could O
be O
available O
to O
everybody O
. O
" O

The O
director O
of O
the O
SEC O
's O
division O
of O
market O
regulation O
, O
Richard B-PERSON
Lindsey E-PERSON
, O
said O
Wall O
Street O
firms O
will O
probably O
need O
to O
spend O
about O
$ O
7 O
million O
to O
carry O
out O
the O
improvements O
called O
for O
by O
the O
new O
rules O
. O

In O
proposing O
the O
rules O
last O
year O
, O
the O
SEC O
noted O
that O
while O
technology O
has O
improved O
, O
commonplace O
practices O
still O
existed O
that O
worked O
against O
investors O
' O
best O
interests O
. O

It O
noted O
that O
customers O
whose O
orders O
were O
not O
displayed O
lost O
the O
chance O
of O
getting O
the O
best O
possible O
price O
available O
in O
the O
market O
. O

It O
also O
cited O
the O
potential O
problem O
of O
a O
two-tiered O
market O
in O
which O
market O
makers O
quote O
one O
price O
to O
public O
investors O
while O
quoting O
better O
prices O
in O
private O
systems O
, O
thus O
robbing O
investors O
without O
access O
to O
" O
hidden O
" O
quotes O
the O
benefit O
of O
the O
best O
available O
prices O
. O

Earlier O
this O
month O
, O
the O
SEC O
settled O
charges O
of O
alleged O
malpractices O
on O
Nasdaq O
when O
the O
parent O
of O
the O
Nasdaq O
market O
, O
the O
National O
Association O
of O
Securities O
Dealers O
, O
agreed O
to O
spend O
$ O
100 O
million O
over O
five O
years O
to O
upgrade O
its O
oversight O
of O
brokers O
' O
trading O
practices O
. O

The O
SEC O
dropped O
a O
third O
proposal O
that O
would O
have O
allowed O
investors O
with O
market O
orders O
to O
trade O
at O
a O
better O
price O
if O
there O
were O
shifts O
in O
prices O
before O
their O
orders O
were O
executed O
. O

The O
agency O
said O
it O
would O
monitor O
effects O
of O
the O
two O
new O
rules O
before O
considering O
the O
" O
price O
improvement O
" O
proposal O
again O
. O

The O
agency O
also O
proposed O
rule O
changes O
that O
would O
require O
continuous O
" O
bid O
" O
and O
" O
ask O
" O
quotations O
from O
exchange O
specialists O
and O
market O
makers O
who O
trade O
more O
than O
1 O
percent O
of O
a O
stock O
during O
any O
quarter O
on O
Nasdaq O
. O

The O
SEC O
's O
limit O
order O
display O
rule O
will O
mean O
a O
major O
change O
for O
Nasdaq O
, O
where O
such O
orders O
have O
never O
been O
displayed O
. O

The O
president O
of O
the O
Nasdaq O
, O
Alfred B-PERSON
Berkeley E-PERSON
, O
was O
to O
hold O
a O
news O
conference O
Wednesday O
afternoon O
to O
elaborate O
on O
the O
new O
rules O
' O
effects O
on O
the O
market O
, O
the O
second O
largest O
in O
the O
world O
. O

on O

the O

framework O
for O

stations O
until O

31 O
, O
1997 O
. O

plugs O
a O

void O
in O

magistrates O
could O
have O

Passengers O
injured O
in O
train O
collision O
in O
Linz O
. O

LINZ O
, O
Austria O
1996-08-28 O

A O
passenger O
train O
collided O
with O
a O
locomotive O
at O
a O
main O
railway O
station O
in O
Linz O
on O
Wednesday O
and O
police O
said O
around O
10 O
people O
were O
injured O
. O

Austrian O
television O
reported O
earlier O
that O
more O
than O
20 O
had O
been O
hurt O
in O
the O
accident O
at O
the O
station O
in O
Linz O
, O
300 O
km O
( O
180 O
miles O
) O
west O
of O
Vienna O
. O

" O
One O
locomotive O
was O
stationary O
and O
the O
passenger O
train O
collided O
into O
the O
back O
of O
it O
, O
" O
a O
police O
spokesman O
in O
Linz O
told O
Reuters O
by O
telephone O
. O

The O
express O
passenger O
train O
travelling O
from O
Steyr O
, O
southeast O
of O
Linz O
, O
with O
around O
80 O
people O
on O
board O
, O
hit O
the O
back O
of O
a O
service O
locomotive O
used O
to O
shunt O
wagons O
into O
sidings O
. O

The O
police O
spokesman O
said O
he O
was O
not O
sure O
whether O
any O
more O
passengers O
were O
still O
trapped O
in O
the O
wreckage O
. O

Doctors O
and O
medical O
staff O
from O
a O
hospital O
across O
the O
road O
from O
the O
station O
were O
at O
the O
scene O
of O
the O
accident O
within O
minutes O
and O
were O
able O
to O
treat O
the O
injured O
quickly O
, O
he O
added O
. O

Greater O
damage O
was O
averted O
as O
the O
driver O
of O
the O
passenger O
train O
had O
time O
to O
apply O
his O
emergency O
brakes O
before O
the O
collision O
occurred O
, O
a O
state O
railways O
spokesman O
told O
Austrian O
news O
agency O
APA O
. O

Saskatchewan O
Wheat O
Pool O
eyes O
hog O
market O
. O

WINNIPEG O
1996-08-28 O

Canada O
's O
largest O
grain O
handling O
firm O
said O
Wednesday O
it O
expects O
to O
forge O
a O
partnership O
with O
hog O
farmers O
by O
1997 O
with O
a O
view O
to O
expanding O
the O
company O
's O
scope O
into O
pork O
production O
. O

" O
Saskatchewan O
is O
well O
positioned O
to O
take O
advantage O
of O
growing O
world O
markets O
for O
pork O
, O
" O
Saskatchewan O
Wheat O
Pool O
chief O
executive O
Don B-PERSON
Loewen E-PERSON
said O
in O
a O
company O
statement O
. O

SWP O
said O
it O
was O
analyzing O
potential O
partnerships O
with O
hog O
farmers O
and O
expected O
the O
first O
deal O
to O
be O
in O
place O
in O
1997 O
. O

The O
end O
of O
Canada O
's O
rail O
freight O
subsidy O
last O
year O
caused O
a O
shift O
in O
feed O
grain O
production O
to O
the O
eastern O
Prairie O
. O

Analysts O
said O
livestock O
production O
would O
likely O
shift O
to O
the O
eastern O
Prairie O
rather O
than O
feed O
grains O
being O
shipped O
to O
the O
western O
Prairie O
. O

SWP O
said O
it O
may O
develop O
pork O
production O
systems O
that O
provide O
farmers O
with O
large O
integrated O
units O
, O
and O
it O
may O
consider O
contracting O
programs O
between O
producers O
and O
packers O
which O
would O
operate O
within O
the O
existing O
hog O
market O
framework O
. O

Saskatchewan O
Pork O
International O
Marketing O
Group O
has O
an O
export O
monopoly O
but O
some O
Saskatchewan O
farmers O
earlier O
this O
month O
called O
for O
an O
open O
market O
in O
hogs O
. O

CYCLING O
- O
BOARDMAN S-PERSON
FULFILS O
WORLD O
RECORD O
PREDICTION O
. O

Martin B-PERSON
Ayres E-PERSON

MANCHESTER O
, O
England O
1996-08-28 O

Britain O
's O
Chris B-PERSON
Boardman E-PERSON
fulfilled O
his O
prediction O
that O
he O
would O
break O
the O
world O
4,000 O
metres O
world O
record O
in O
the O
world O
track O
cycling O
championships O
on O
Wednesday O
. O

Boardman S-PERSON
clocked O
four O
minutes O
13.353 O
seconds O
to O
slice O
more O
than O
six O
seconds O
from O
the O
previous O
world O
mark O
of O
4:19.699 O
set O
by O
Olympic O
champion O
Andrea B-PERSON
Collinelli E-PERSON
of O
Italy O
in O
Atlanta O
in O
July O
. O

Collinelli S-PERSON
qualified O
in O
second O
place O
, O
also O
beating O
his O
old O
record O
in O
4:17.696 O
. O

" O
I O
was O
very O
nervous O
before O
the O
start O
but O
then O
I O
was O
amazed O
by O
the O
speed O
of O
my O
ride O
, O
" O
Boardman S-PERSON
said O
. O
" O

I O
do O
n't O
know O
if O
I O
can O
go O
any O
faster O
. O

Who O
knows O
what O
will O
happen O
in O
the O
later O
stages O
? O
" O

Boardman S-PERSON
, O
28 O
, O
did O
not O
contest O
the O
Olympic O
pursuit O
because O
of O
its O
proximity O
to O
the O
Tour O
de O
France O
in O
which O
he O
led O
the O
French O
GAN O
team O
. O

However O
, O
he O
took O
a O
bronze O
medal O
in O
the O
Olympic O
road O
time-trial O
and O
then O
returned O
home O
to O
prepare O
for O
the O
world O
track O
series O
in O
the O
Manchester O
indoor O
velodrome O
. O

He O
adopted O
the O
" O
superman O
" O
riding O
position O
with O
arms O
at O
full O
stretch O
perfected O
by O
fellow O
Briton O
Graeme B-PERSON
Obree E-PERSON
, O
the O
1995 O
world O
champion O
, O
and O
taken O
up O
in O
Atlanta O
by O
Collinelli S-PERSON
. O

Obree S-PERSON
was O
forced O
to O
pull O
out O
of O
his O
title O
defence O
because O
of O
a O
viral O
infection O
. O

for O
Wednesday O
evening O
's O
quarter-finals O
: O

TENNIS O
- O
GRAF S-PERSON
WORKS O
HARD O
FOR O
FIRST-ROUND O
WIN O
. O

Bill B-PERSON
Berkrot E-PERSON

NEW O
YORK O
1996-08-27 O

It O
was O
n't O
supposed O
to O
be O
this O
hard O
for O
defending O
champion O
Steffi B-PERSON
Graf E-PERSON
to O

opening O

at O
the O
U.S. O
Open O
on O
Tuesday O
night O
. O

But O
the O

that O
called O
for O
the O
usual O

by O
the O
top-ranked O

seed O
was O
rewritten O
by O
29th-ranked O
Indonesian O
Yayuk B-PERSON
Basuki E-PERSON
playing O
with O
nothing O
to O
lose O
abandon O
. O

Graf S-PERSON
, O
of O
course O
, O
prevailed O
6-3 O
7-6 O
, O
but O
not O
before O
some O
tense O
moments O
that O
even O
had O
the O
German O
superstar O
thinking O
the O
match O
was O
going O
three O
sets O
. O

" O
I O
won O
the O
second O
set O
, O
which O
I O
did O

think O
I O
would O
do O
, O
being O
down O
5-2 O
and O
the O
chances O
she O
had O
at O
6-5 O
, O
" O
Graf S-PERSON
recalled O
. O

Several O
of O
the O
other O
women O
's O
seeds O
eased O
into O
the O
second O
round O
with O
more O
typical O
Graf-like O
efficiency O
Tuesday O
. O

turned O
to O

, O
fourth-seeded O
Spaniard O
Conchita B-PERSON
Martinez E-PERSON
took O
apart O

with O
the O

of O
just O
two O

, O

than O

, O

no O

's O

, O

lost O

Huber E-PERSON
( O
6 O
) O

, O

20 O

- O

CHICAGO O
1996-08-27 O

will O

SOCCER O
- O
MARCELO S-PERSON
HAT-TRICK O
KEEPS O
PSV O
AT O
TOP O
OF O
DUTCH O
LEAGUE O
. O

AMSTERDAM O
1996-08-28 O

Brazilian O
striker O
Marcelo S-PERSON
scored O
a O

as O
PSV O
Eindhoven O
maintained O
their O
100 O
percent O

and O
stayed O
on O
top O
of O
the O
Dutch O
first O

with O

at O

. O

's O

for O

, O

, O

of O
their O

CRICKET O
- O

CAPTAIN O

UPSTAGED O
BY O
120 O
FROM O
JAYASURIYA S-PERSON
. O

COLOMBO O
1996-08-28 O

a O

, O

, O

de I-PERSON

49 O

DE O

- O

Leslie B-PERSON

BOSTON O

. O

was O
down O
. O

Chiron O
makes O

; O

, O

. O

, O

the O

said O
both O
Biogen O
's O
product O
and O
Betaseron O
were O
developed O
under O
the O
incentives O
of O
the O
Ophran O
Drug O
Act O
which O
provides O
seven O
years O
of O

for O
products O
that O
treat O
rare O
diseases O
. O

Avonex O
" O
has O
been O
allowed O
to O
enter O
the O
market O
because O
it O
differs O
from O
interferon O
beta-1b O
( O
Betaseron O
) O
.. O

. O
" O

the O
FDA O
said O
. O

Now O
, O
U.S. O
District O
Judge O
Mark B-PERSON

ordered O
the O
chief O

for O
Biogen O
, O

" O

last O

. O

. O

1241 O
- O
Alexander B-PERSON
III E-PERSON
, O
King O
of O

, O
born O

and O

. O

- O
Francois-Rene B-PERSON
( I-PERSON

de I-PERSON
) I-PERSON
Chateaubriand E-PERSON

. O

-DOCSTART- -X- -X- O

UK O
lowers O
noise O
limits O
for O
three O
London O
airports O
. O

LONDON O
1996-08-28 O

The O
British O
government O
on O
Wednesday O
lowered O
the O
noise O
limits O
for O
London O
's O
Heathrow O
, O
Gatwick O
and O
Stansted O
airports O
and O
announced O
it O
would O
make O
a O
bigger O
effort O
in O
detecting O
and O
fining O
violators O
. O

The O
limits O
, O
effective O
from O
January O
1 O
, O
1997 O
, O
are O
reduced O
as O
much O
as O
possible O
while O
still O
complying O
with O
international O
obligations O
, O
a O
spokesman O
for O
the O
Department O
of O
Transport O
said O
. O

The O
maximum O
noise O
level O
during O
the O
day O
is O
trimmed O
by O
three O
decibels O
to O
94 O
, O
while O
the O
night O
time O
level O
is O
reduced O
by O
two O
decibels O
to O
87 O
. O

" O
It O
is O
a O
smaller O
reduction O
in O
terms O
of O
loudness O
than O
was O
sought O
by O
local O
people O
. O

Nevertheless O
I O
am O
satisfied O
that O
the O
overall O
benefits O
will O
be O
worthwile O
, O
" O
Lord O
Goschen S-PERSON
, O
minister O
for O
aviation O
, O
said O
in O
a O
statement O
. O

The O
ministry O
said O
it O
believed O
the O
new O
limits O
could O
be O
met O
with O
existing O
aircraft O
. O
" O

They O
can O
be O
flown O
in O
quieter O
ways O
, O
" O
a O
spokesman O
said O
. O

The O
reduction O
in O
noise O
levels O
is O
the O
same O
as O
proposed O
in O
a O
consultation O
paper O
which O
was O
published O
in O
October O
1995 O
. O

The O
present O
noise O
levels O
have O
applied O
at O
Heathrow O
, O
one O
of O
the O
world O
's O
busiest O
airports O
, O
since O

Romania O
state O
budget O

in O

. O

BUCHAREST O
1996-08-28 O

Romania O
's O
state O
budget O
deficit O
jumped O
sharply O
in O
June O
to O
1,242.9 O
billion O
lei O
for O
the O
January-June O
period O
from O
596.5 O
billion O
lei O
in O
January-May O
, O
official O
data O
showed O
on O
Wednesday O
. O

Six-month O
expenditures O
stood O
at O
9.50 O
trillion O
lei O
, O
up O
from O
7.56 O
trillion O
lei O
at O
end-May O
, O
with O
education O
and O
health O
spending O
accounting O
for O
31.6 O
percent O
of O
state O
expenses O
and O
economic O
subsidies O
and O
support O
taking O
some O
26 O
percent O
. O

January-June O
revenues O
went O
up O
to O
8.26 O
trillion O
lei O
from O
6.96 O
trillion O
lei O
in O
the O
first O
five O
months O
this O
year O
. O

Romania O
's O
government O
is O
expected O
to O
revise O
the O
1996 O
budget O
on O
Wednesday O
to O
bring O
it O
into O
line O
with O
higher O
inflation O

new O

and O
pension O
indexations O
and O
costs O
of O
energy O
imports O
that O
have O
pushed O
up O
the O
state O
deficit O
. O

Under O
the O
revised O
version O
state O
spending O
is O
expected O
to O
rise O
by O
some O
566 O
billion O
lei O
. O

No O
new O
deficit O
forecast O
has O
been O
issued O
so O
far O
. O

In O
July O
the O
government O
gave O
a O
6.0-percent O
wage O
and O
pension O
indexation O
to O
cover O
energy O
, O
fuel O
and O
bread O
price O
increases O
, O
which O
quickened O
inflation O
to O
7.5 O
percent O
last O
month O
. O

In O
the O
original O
state O
budget O
, O
approved O
in O
March O
, O
revenues O
were O
envisaged O
at O
around O
16.98 O
trillion O
lei O
and O
expenditures O
20.17 O
trillion O
lei O
for O
1996 O
. O

The O
state O
budget O
deficit O
was O
originally O
forecast O
to O
be O
3.19 O
trillion O
lei O
for O
the O
whole O
year O
. O

On O
Wednesday O
, O
the O
leu O
's O
official O
rate O
was O
3,161 O
to O
the O
dollar O
. O

Tuesday O
by O
two O

, O
one O

a O

of O

own O

in O

, O

Samper S-PERSON
-- O

Angeles O
, O
Dole S-PERSON
's O
running O
mate O
, O
Jack B-PERSON
Kemp E-PERSON
, O
campaigned O
aggressively O
for O
the O
black O
vote O
in O
an O
area O
that O
was O
the O

of O
the O
1992 O

. O

Kemp S-PERSON
told O
a O

of O
about O

in O

central O

, O
" O
Keep O
your O

, O

to O
a O

that O
was O

, O

likened O

to O

" O

of O

, O

taking O
. O

CHICAGO O
1996-08-28 O

Profit O
taking O
continued O
to O
weigh O
on O
CME O
lumber O
futures O
but O
prices O
ended O
only O
slightly O
lower O
as O
strong O
cash O
markets O
underpinned O

, O
traders O
said O
. O

The O
same O
pattern O
of O
the O
past O
few O
days O
persisted O
with O
futures O
declining O
early O
on O
the O
profit O
taking O
before O
firming O
late O
. O

There O
was O
cash-related O
buying O
late O
from O
people O
who O
want O
to O
take O
delivery O
of O
the O
September O

, O

said O
. O

noted O
that O

is O
generally O
quiet O
, O
prices O
remain O
firm O
on O
demand O
for O
prompt O
delivery O
wood O
, O
they O
added O
. O

Random O
Lengths O
quoted O
cash O
spruce O
at O
$ O
419 O
per O
tbf O
, O
up O
$ O
5 O
from O
last O
Friday O
and O
$ O
7 O
over O
the O
last O

quote O
. O

Reduced O

over O

Edouard O
prompted O
some O
of O
the O
early O
profit O
taking O
. O

more O
to O
the O
north O

, O

. O

2.20 O

WHEAT--Rains O
boost O
U.S. O
HRW O
planting O
prospects O
. O

Greg B-PERSON
Frost E-PERSON

KANSAS O
CITY O
, O
Mo O
. O

1996-08-28 O

Above-normal O
summer O
rainfall O
in O
the O
U.S. O
High O
Plains O
has O
produced O
near-ideal O
conditions O
for O
planting O
the O
1997 O
hard O
red O
winter O
wheat O
crop O
, O
analysts O
said O
Wednesday O
. O

From O
central O
Texas O
north O
to O
Kansas O
, O
rains O
throughout O
July O
and O
August O
have O
relieved O
most O
of O
the O
drought O
conditions O
that O
plagued O
the O
region O
earlier O
this O
year O
. O

" O
Our O
moisture O
situation O
is O
excellent O
, O
especially O
for O
fall O
planting O
of O
winter O
wheat O
, O
" O
said O
Kim B-PERSON
Anderson E-PERSON
, O
extension O
wheat O
marketing O
economist O
at O
Oklahoma O
State O
University O
. O

The O
irony O
of O
the O
above-average O
summer O
rainfall O
was O
not O
lost O
on O
High O
Plains O
wheat O
producers O
, O
who O
only O
three O
months O
ago O
were O
caught O
in O
a O
drought O
so O
severe O
that O
old-timers O
likened O
conditions O
to O
the O
" O
Dust O
Bowl O
" O
days O
of O
the O
1930s O
. O

" O
It O
's O
definitely O
a O
turnabout O
from O
this O
past O
year O
, O
but O
you O
know O
last O
year O
we O
had O
pretty O
good O
moisture O
about O
this O
time O
of O
year O
, O
and O
then O
about O
October O
1 O
it O
quit O
, O
" O
said O
Mark B-PERSON
Hodges E-PERSON
, O
executive O
director O
of O
the O
Oklahoma O
Wheat O
Commission O
. O
" O

Hopefully O
that O
's O
not O
going O
to O
happen O
this O
year O
. O
" O

According O
to O
figures O
released O
by O
the O
Oklahoma O
Climatological O
Survey O
, O
an O
average O
of O
20.19 O
inches O
fell O
across O
the O
state O
between O
March O
1 O
and O
August O
26 O
, O
1996 O
. O

That O
's O
about O
1/2 O
inch O
above O
the O
average O
for O
the O
same O
time O
period O
, O
according O
to O
Howard B-PERSON
Johnson E-PERSON
, O
associate O
state O
climatologist O
at O
the O
University O
of O
Oklahoma O
. O

He O
noted O
that O
the O
majority O
of O
that O
20.19 O
inches O
had O
fallen O
since O
July O
. O

As O
an O
example O
of O
just O
how O
dry O
it O
was O
, O
data O
showed O
that O
between O
October O
1 O
, O
1995 O
and O
March O
1 O
, O
1996 O
, O
the O
state O
received O
an O
average O
of O
only O
4.6 O
inches O
of O

. O

In O

Texas O
, O
the O
current O
rainfall O
situation O
was O
similar O
to O
most O
of O
Oklahoma O
, O
said O
Rodney B-PERSON
Mosier E-PERSON
, O
executive O

for O

Texas O
Wheat O

. O

" O

here O
in O
the O
Texas O
Panhandle O
, O
we O
've O
had O
some O
extremely O
beneficial O
rains O
that O
came O
through O
within O
the O
last O
several O
days O
and O
are O
really O
setting O
us O
up O
for O
ideal O
conditions O
for O

wheat O
, O
" O
Mosier S-PERSON
said O
. O

But O

that O
the O

was O
not O
as O

in O

mositure O
levels O
were O

last O

. O

In O

, O
typically O
the O
number O
one O
U.S. O
hard O
red O
winter O
wheat O

. O

First O
Union O
National O
Bank O
of O
Fla. O
settles O
suit O
. O

JACKSONVILLE O
, O
Fla. O
1996-08-28 O

First O
Union O
National O
Bank O
of O
Florida O
said O
on O
Wednesday O
it O
agreed O
to O
settle O
a O
class O
action O
law O
suit O
involving O
its O
collateral O
protection O
insurance O
( O
CPI O
) O
program O
. O

To O
provide O
for O
the O
settlements O
, O
First O
Union O
has O
established O
a O
common O
fund O
of O
$ O
4.7 O
million O
for O
cash O
refunds O
and O
$ O
19.4 O
million O
in O
credit O
refunds O
for O
outstanding O
CPI O
balances O
. O

The O
bank O
is O
a O
division O
of O
First O
Union O
Corp O
. O

The O
bank O
said O
most O
of O
the O
charges O
resulted O
from O
loan O
portfolios O
from O
banks O
and O
thrifts O
that O
were O
acquired O
in O
the O
1980s O
. O

First O
Union O
said O
it O
has O
discontinued O
CPI O
as O
an O
element O
of O
its O
motor O
vehicle O
or O
boat O
installment O
loan O
contracts O
. O

As O
part O
of O
the O
settlement O
agreement O
, O
customers O
who O
had O
CPI O
placed O
on O
loans O
from O
January O
1 O
, O
1986 O
to O
September O
31 O
, O
1996 O
, O
will O
receive O
cash O
or O
credit O
refunds O
, O
the O
bank O
said O
. O

Cash O
refunds O
will O
go O
to O
those O
who O
paid O
their O
loans O
to O
First O
Union O
while O
credit O
refunds O
will O
go O
to O
those O
who O
have O
existing O
loan O
balances O
, O
the O
bank O
said O
. O

Burundi O
defends O
military O
regime O
to O
hostile O
UN O
. O

Evelyn B-PERSON
Leopold E-PERSON

UNITED O
NATIONS O
1996-08-28 O

Burundi O
's O
ambassador O
on O
Wednesday O
lashed O
out O
at O
economic O
sanctions O
imposed O
by O
African O
states O
and O
said O
any O
thought O
of O
an O
arms O
embargo O
would O
be O
a O
windfall O
for O
guerrillas O
fighting O
his O
army-run O
government O
. O

In O
a O
lengthy O
debate O
on O
Burundi O
before O
the O
U.N. O
Security O
Council O
, O
Ambassador O
Nsanze B-PERSON
Terence E-PERSON
said O
the O
new O
military O
government O
took O

to O

the O

and O

negotiations O
under O

. O

Nearly O

, O

as O

, O

, O
an O

. O

" O

( O

) O

of O

" O

said O
of O

. O

had O

Chile O

KARACHI O

1996-08-28 O

through O

on O
Wednesday O

the O
removal O
of O
Pakistani O
Prime O
Minister O
Benazir B-PERSON
Bhutto E-PERSON
, O

said O
. O

" O

will O
march O
to O

and O
by O

we O
will O
not O

and O
( O

Asif B-PERSON
Ali E-PERSON
) O
Zardari S-PERSON

, O
" O
Nawaz B-PERSON

, O
leader O
of O
the O
main O

Pakistan O

League O
told O
a O

a O

. O

accused O

of O

, O

has O

in O

for O

, O

. O

of O

on O

, O

" O

of O

, O

said O
. O

Karachi O

( O

) O

of O

in O

last O

. O

BOMBAY O
1996-08-28 O

India O

) O

million O

in O

1996 O
from O
2.93 O
million O
a O

. O

ACC O
Chairman O
Nani B-PERSON
Palkhivala E-PERSON
told O

at O
the O
firm O
's O

output O
rose O
to O
3.14 O
million O

in O
the O

of O
1996/97 O
( O
April-March O
) O
, O
from O
3.01 O
million O
a O
year O
ago O
. O

Palkhivala S-PERSON
said O
ACC O
had O
secured O

to O

over O
a O
sick O

firm O
with O
a O

capacity O
of O

per O

. O
" O

We O
will O

over O

, O
" O

. O

, O

in O

. O

" O

percent O
over O
1994/95 O
from O
77.79 O
million O

87.45 O
million O

, O
" O

. O

about O

from O
the O
previous O

of O

- O
Sri O

. O

during O
the O

of O

. O

in O

in O

, O

. O

BOMBAY O
1996-08-28 O

Ltd O

) O

, O

company O
said O

on O

. O

is O
at O

plus O

, O

. O

The O

, O

, O

in O

. O

Spanish O
tomato O
warriors O
paint O
the O
town O
red O
. O

BUNOL O
, O
Spain O
1996-08-28 O

Revellers O
painted O
the O
town O
red O
on O
Wednesday O
as O
the O
1996 O
edition O
of O
the O
world O
's O
biggest O
tomato O
fight O
began O
in O
the O
eastern O
Spanish O
village O
of O
Bunol O
. O

Thousands O
of O
people O
pelted O
each O
other O
with O
armfuls O
of O
ripe O
tomatoes O
as O
streets O
, O
walls O
and O
windows O
were O
coated O
in O
a O
blood-red O
wash O
. O

A O
single O
firework O
after O
midday O
signalled O
the O
start O
of O
the O
fruit-throwing O
frenzy O
, O
during O
which O
participants O
hurl O
some O
100 O
tonnes O
of O
tomatoes O
trucked O
in O
for O
the O
occasion O
. O

Local O
historians O
say O
the O
tradition O
began O
in O
1945 O
when O
disgruntled O
locals O
began O
spontaneously O
to O
bombard O
the O
priest O
and O
mayor O
at O
the O
annual O
fiesta O
in O
Bunol O
( O
pronounced O
Boo-nee-OL O
) O
. O

The O
festival O
's O
fame O
has O
grown O
and O
now O
attracts O
between O
15,000 O
and O
20,000 O
people O
, O
many O
of O
them O
foreigners O
. O

MOF O

rate O

. O

has O

. O

BRUSSELS O
1996-08-29 O

The O
European O
Commission O
said O
on O
Thursday O
it O
would O
study O
scientific O
reports O
saying O
Britain O
's O
mad O
cow O

would O
die O
out O
by O
2001 O
but O
offered O
little O
prospect O
the O
findings O
would O
change O
an O
agreed O
slaughter O
campaign O
. O

" O
Obviously O
we O
are O
interested O
in O
this O
research O
. O

We O
will O
ask O
the O
( O
EU O
) O
scientific O
and O

committee O
to O
examine O
it O
, O
" O
Commission O

Gerard B-PERSON
Kiely E-PERSON

. O

But O

added O
that O
new O
research O
into O

dynamics O
of O
the O

( O

) O
, O
a O

disease O
suffered O
by O
cattle O
, O
was O
unlikely O
to O
alter O
a O
slaughter O
plan O
agreed O
by O

and O
its O
14 O
EU O

. O

" O

agreed O
that O
following O

analysis O
using O
a O

which O
would O
take O
out O
the O
maximum O
number O
of O
BSE O
cases O
possible O
. O

I O
think O

would O

very O
difficult O
to O
sell O
to O
the O
European O
Commission O
a O
programme O
which O
would O
involve O
the O

of O
fewer O
BSE O
cases O
, O
" O
Kiely S-PERSON
said O
. O

" O
We O
will O
look O
at O
our O
approach O
( O
to O
the O
plan O
) O
but O
we O
wo O
n't O
get O
involved O
with O
the O
number O
of O
animals O
to O

, O
" O
he O
said O
. O

" O

have O
always O
avoided O
the O
question O
of O
numbers O
of O
animals O
to O
be O
slaughtered O
, O
that O
's O
not O
the O
issue O
. O

The O
issue O
is O
the O
protection O
of O
consumers O
' O
health O
and O
the O
rapid O
eradication O
of O
BSE O
, O
" O
he O
added O
. O

The O
reaction O
is O
likely O
to O
disappoint O
British O
farmers O
, O
who O
seized O
on O
research O
by O
Oxford O
scientists O
in O
the O
scientific O
journal O
Nature O
saying O
it O
would O
be O
hard O
to O
get O
rid O
of O
the O
disease O
any O
faster O
than O
2001 O
without O
killing O
vast O
numbers O
of O
cattle O
. O

The O
researchers O
predicted O
there O
would O
be O
340 O
new O
infections O
and O
14,000 O
new O
cases O
of O
BSE O
before O
2001 O
. O

British O
farmers O
' O
leader O
called O
on O
Wednesday O
for O

urgent O

with O
ministers O
to O
discuss O

report O
. O

" O

believe O

is O

" O

. O

a O

TENNIS O
- O
MARTINEZ S-PERSON
GETS O
AGGRESSIVE O
AT O
U.S. O
OPEN O
. O

Larry B-PERSON
Fine E-PERSON

NEW O
YORK O
1996-08-28 O

Conchita B-PERSON
Martinez E-PERSON
decided O
that O
when O
in O
New O
York O
, O
do O
as O
the O
New O
Yorkers O
do O
-- O
and O
the O
Spaniard O
's O
new-found O
aggressiveness O
seems O
to O
have O
put O
her O
in O
the O
right O
frame O
of O
mind O
for O
the O
U.S. O
Open O
. O

The O
fourth-seeded O
Spaniard O
, O
who O
is O
tackling O
the O
world O
class O
traffic O
of O
New O
York O
City O
as O
a O
warm-up O
by O
driving O
to O
the O
tennis O
centre O
for O
her O
matches O
, O
ran O
over O
France O
's O
Nathalie B-PERSON
Tauziat E-PERSON
6-1 O
6-3 O
on O
Wednesday O
to O
take O
her O
place O
in O
the O
third O
round O
. O

" O
I O
've O
been O
trying O
my O
whole O
career O
to O
be O
aggressive O
, O
" O
said O
the O
24-year-old O
Martinez S-PERSON
after O
crushing O
Tauziat S-PERSON
in O
just O
over O
an O
hour O
. O

" O
What O
I O
'm O
trying O
to O
do O
is O
be O
aggressive O
all O
the O
time O
, O
maybe O
go O
up O
to O
the O
net O
a O
few O
times O
like O
I O
did O
tonight O
. O

That O
would O
really O
help O
. O
" O

Martinez S-PERSON
, O
the O
1994 O
Wimbledon O
champion O
, O
used O
to O
struggle O
at O
the O
Open O
, O
but O
has O
come O
to O
terms O
with O
the O
noise O
, O
crowds O
and O
chaos O
. O

" O

BRITAIN O
WELCOMES O
ROMANIA-HUNGARY O
TREATY O
ACCORD O
. O

BUCHAREST O
1996-08-29 O

Britain O
joined O
the O
United O
States O
on O
Thursday O
in O
welcoming O
Romania O
and O
Hungary O
's O
agreement O
on O
the O
text O
of O
a O
much-delayed O
friendship O
treaty O
, O
which O
it O
said O
would O
contribute O
to O
stability O
in O
the O
area O
. O

" O
The O
United O
Kingdom O
believes O
that O
such O
a O
treaty O
will O
contribute O
positively O
to O
the O
further O
development O
of O
good O
neighbourly O
relations O
between O
the O
two O
countries O
and O
enhance O
the O
stability O
of O
the O
region O
, O
" O
said O
the O
British O
Foreign O
office O
statement O
. O

The O
accord O
, O
agreed O
two O
weeks O
ago O
, O
is O
expected O
to O
end O
years O
of O
disputes O
over O
the O
status O
of O
Romania O
's O
large O
ethnic O
Hungarian O
minority O
. O

It O
will O
also O
boost O
both O
countries O
' O
ambitions O
to O
join O
NATO O
and O
the O
European O
Union O
. O

Bucharest O
and O
Budapest O
say O
the O
treaty O
should O
be O
signed O
in O
the O
first O
half O
of O
September O
. O

" O
The O
United O
Kingdom O
looks O
forward O
to O
the O
early O
signature O
of O
the O
treaty O
, O
" O
the O
statement O
said O
. O

BELGRADE O

in O

to O

2,901.48 O

, O

2,891.00 O

a O

( O

. O

Starting O

was O
2,746 O

a O

and O

. O

The O

0.042 O
percent O
of O

's O

. O

The O

said O
that O
since O

began O
, O
139.75 O
million O
shares O
, O
equivalent O
to O
0.59 O
percent O
of O
Gazprom O
, O
have O
changed O
hands O
. O

Gazprom O
, O
Russia O
's O
biggest O
company O
by O
market O
capitalisation O
, O
has O
massive O
reserves O
and O
potentially O
huge O
earnings O
. O

However O
, O
its O
23.6 O
billion O
shares O
are O
highly O
illiquid O
and O
management O
permission O
is O
required O
to O
sell O
them O
. O

Gazprom O
has O
recently O
tightened O
these O
rules O
, O
making O
it O
harder O
for O
shareholders O
to O
sell O
to O
whoever O
they O
want O
, O
when O
they O
want O
. O

The O
company O
has O
organised O
regular O
auctions O
of O
its O
shares O
to O
create O
an O
orderly O
market O
in O
the O
paper O
. O

At O
the O
first O
auction O
on O
March O
6 O
, O
shares O
sold O
for O
an O
average O
406.6 O
roubles O
each O
, O
and O
prices O
have O
been O
rising O
steadily O
since O
then O
, O
but O
the O
rise O
in O
price O
this O
week O
and O
last O
was O
much O
less O
than O
in O
previous O

. O

, O

25 O

, O

. O

in O

-DOCSTART- -X- -X- O

Researchers O
report O
progress O
in O
muscular O
dystrophy O
. O

PHILADELPHIA O
1996-08-29 O

University O
of O
Pennsylvania O
researchers O
on O
Thursday O
said O
a O
new O
gene-therapy O
technique O
for O
treating O
muscular O
dystrophy O
disease O
had O
shown O
progress O
in O
laboratory O
animals O
. O

Word O
of O
the O
findings O
, O
to O
be O
published O
in O
the O
Oct. O
1 O
issue O
of O
the O
journal O
" O
Human O
Gene O
Therapy O
, O
" O
came O
in O
advance O
of O
the O
annual O
Jerry O
Lewis O
Labour O
Day O
weekend O
telethon O
to O
raise O
money O
for O
muscular O
dystrophy O
research O
. O

Several O
hurdles O
must O
be O
overcome O
before O
the O
method O
is O
used O
in O
human O
trials O
. O

Nevertheless O
, O
" O
a O
treatment O
based O
on O
the O
new O
strategy O
.... O
may O
have O
the O
potential O
to O
benefit O
many O
patients O
, O
" O
the O
University O
of O
Pennsylvania O
Medical O
Centre O
said O
in O
a O
release O
. O

Muscular O
dystrophy O
is O
a O
fatal O
illness O
in O
which O
the O
body O
's O
muscle O
tissue O
degenerates O
and O
is O
replaced O
by O
fat O
. O

Death O
strikes O
in O
early O
adulthood O
. O

Individuals O
with O
the O
disease O
have O
a O
non-working O
version O
of O
a O
gene O
responsible O
for O
producing O
a O
crucial O
muscle O
protein O
called O
dystrophin O
. O

In O
the O
study O
at O
the O
University O
's O
Institute O
for O
Human O
Gene O
Therapy O
, O
researchers O
altered O
a O
common-cold O
virus O
to O
carry O
a O
version O
of O
the O
working O
dystrophin O
gene O
. O

The O
virus O
, O
which O
also O
was O
altered O
to O
minimise O
its O
susceptibility O
to O
the O
immune O
system O
, O
was O
then O
injected O
into O
the O
muscle O
cells O
of O
mice O
bred O
to O
lack O
dystrophin O
genes O
. O

In O
the O
experiment O
, O
between O
30 O
to O
40 O
percent O
of O
the O
muscle O
fibers O
in O
one O
group O
of O
mice O
produced O
dystrophin O
for O
two O
weeks O
before O
diminishing O
. O

Similar O
results O
had O
been O
obtained O
previously O
in O
test-tube O
cell O
cultures O
, O
but O
not O
in O
live O
animals O
, O
the O
university O
said O
. O

The O
university O
said O
methods O
are O
still O
needed O
to O
make O
enough O
of O
the O
altered O
virus O
to O
treat O
humans O
, O
to O
further O
decrease O
the O
immune-system O
response O
to O
the O
virus O
, O
and O
to O
deliver O
the O
virus O
to O
human O
muscle O
tissue O
. O

Help-wanted O

NEW O
YORK O
1996-08-29 O

The O
help-wanted O
advertising O
index O
fell O
in O
July O
, O
the O
Conference O
Board O
said O
Thursday O
, O
reflecting O
the O
uneven O
nature O
of O
the O
nation O
's O
labour O
markets O
. O

The O
monthly O
index O
fell O
to O
83.0 O
in O
July O
against O
a O
reading O
of O
85.0 O
in O
June O
, O
the O
private O
business O
research O
group O
said O
. O

In O
July O
, O
the O
volume O
of O
help-wanted O
advertising O
fell O
in O
five O
of O
the O
nine O
U.S. O
regions O
. O

" O
The O
labour O
market O
has O
been O
expanding O
throughout O
1996 O
, O
but O

in O

at O

ports O
, O

to O

. O

a O

fob O
Gulf O

, O

, O

. O

last O

, O

, O

FEATURE O
- O
Rich O
new O
detail O
on O
U.S. O
Civil O
War O
unearthed O
. O

Leila B-PERSON
Corcoran E-PERSON

WASHINGTON O
1996-08-29 O

A O
freed O
black O
man O
writes O
to O
his O
still-enslaved O
wife O
, O
a O
mother O
pleads O
with O
Abraham B-PERSON
Lincoln E-PERSON
on O
behalf O
of O
her O
son O
and O
a O
maimed O
soldier O
poses O
for O
an O
official O
photograph O
in O
newly O
reopened O
records O
that O
bring O
the O
U.S. O
Civil O
War O
back O
to O
life O
. O

Working O
in O
the O
basement O
of O
the O
National O
Archives O
, O
members O
of O
the O
Civil O
War O
Conservation O
Corps O
are O
organising O
the O
military O
records O
of O
volunteers O
who O
fought O
for O
the O
North O
so O
that O
they O
can O
be O
preserved O
on O
microfilm O
. O

The O
faded O
documents O
have O
been O
stowed O
away O
in O
the O
Archives O
since O
it O
opened O
in O
1935 O
and O
have O
rarely O
seen O
the O
light O
of O
day O
. O

' O
( O

. O

. O

" O

" O

. O

. O

WELLINGTON O
1996-08-29 O

An O
earthquake O
measuring O
5.5 O
on O
the O
Richter S-PERSON
scale O
shook O
New O
Zealands O
upper O
South O
Island O
on O
Thursday O
but O
there O
were O
no O
reports O
of O
injuries O
, O
Television O
New O
Zealand O
said O
. O

It O
said O
the O
quake O
, O
centred O
near O
the O
small O
town O
of O
Waiau O
, O
was O
strongly O
felt O
in O
the O
cities O
of O
Nelson O
and O
Christchurch O
. O

Some O
minor O
damage O
had O
been O
reported O
in O
the O
spa O
town O
of O
Hanmer O
. O

New O
Zealand O
is O
prone O

frequent O
earthquakes O
but O
they O
rarely O
cause O
major O
damage O
. O

country O

only O
3.5 O
million O
people O
in O
an O
area O
about O

size O
of O
Britain O
or O
Japan O
. O

HK O

on O
China O

. O

HONG O
KONG O
1996-08-29 O

Senior O
Hong O
Kong O
civil O
servants O
were O
given O
the O
go-ahead O
on O
Thursday O
to O
challenge O
a O
government O
ban O
on O
them O
standing O
for O
the O
Beijing-backed O
panel O
to O
choose O
the O
territory O
's O
first O
post-handover O
leader O
and O
lawmakers O
. O

The O
Supreme O
Court O
ruled O
that O
a O
judicial O
hearing O
contesting O
the O
ban O
would O
be O
heard O
on O
September O
11 O
, O
three O
days O
before O
the O
nomination O
period O
for O
the O
Selection O
Committee O
closes O
. O

The O
government O
maintains O
the O
ban O
, O
announced O
earlier O
this O
month O
, O
is O
necessary O
to O
avoid O
a O
possible O
conflict O
of O
interest O
because O
civil O
servants O
are O
involved O
in O
determining O
government O
policy O
. O

Civil O
servants O
argue O
the O
ban O
stymies O
their O
political O
rights O
. O

The O
400-strong O
Selection O
Committee O
will O
select O
Hong O
Kong O
's O
future O
chief O
executive O
to O
replace O
the O
British O
governor O
and O
a O
provisional O
legislature O
to O
take O
over O
from O
the O
elected O
chamber O
which O
Beijing O
plans O
to O
dissolve O
. O

Hong O
Kong O
, O
a O
British O
colony O
for O
more O
than O
150 O
years O
, O
will O
be O
handed O
back O
to O
China O
at O
midnight O
on O
June O
30 O
next O
year O
. O

China O
intends O
to O
dismantle O
the O
territory O
's O
first O
fully-elected O
legislature O
because O
it O
opposes O
Britain O
's O
recent O
electoral O
reforms O
and O
install O
an O
interim O
appointed O
chamber O
, O
a O
decision O
that O
has O
generated O
considerable O
controversy O
. O

The O
judicial O
review O
sought O
by O
directorate-grade O
bureaucrats O
will O
apply O
to O
only O
about O
1,000 O
of O
the O
approximately O
33,000 O
civil O
servants O
affected O
. O

Police O
unions O
are O
not O
contesting O
the O
ban O
, O
which O
affects O
all O
27,000 O
officers O
, O
and O
nor O
are O
the O
very O
top O
tier O
of O
Hong O
Kong O
's O
mandarin O
class O
, O
the O
policy O
secretaries O
. O

More O
than O
16,000 O
application O
forms O
for O
places O
on O
the O
Selection O
Committee O
have O
been O
handed O
out O
since O
the O
nomination O
period O
opened O
. O

It O
closes O
on O
September O
14 O
. O

SINGAPORE O
1996-08-29 O

Singapore O
Refining O
Company O
( O
SRC O
) O
is O
expected O
to O
shutdown O
its O
60,000 O
barrel-per-day O
( O
bpd O
) O
crude O
distillation O
unit O
( O
CDU O
) O
in O
September O
, O
an O
industry O
source O
said O
on O
Thursday O
. O

" O
They O
think O
something O
is O
stuck O
, O
" O
the O
source O
said O
. O
" O

But O
nothing O
has O
been O
decided O
as O
they O
are O
still O
waiting O
for O
an O
X-ray O
machine O
to O
determine O
the O
problem O
. O
" O

The O
source O
said O
the O
problem O
was O
discovered O
during O
the O
past O
month O
during O
which O
time O
CDU O
No.3 O
's O
production O
has O
varied O
from O
maximum O
capacity O
of O
60,000 O
bpd O
to O
as O
low O
as O
40,000 O
bpd O
, O
depending O
on O
the O
crude O
being O
run O
. O

" O

are O
having O
a O
lot O
of O
problems O
, O
" O
said O
a O
source O
. O

CDU O
No O
. O

3 O

on O

24 O

in O
August O

to O
a O

. O

by O
mid-August O
, O
a O
company O
spokesman O
said O
repairs O
had O
been O
carried O
out O
without O
any O

. O

285,000 O
bpd O

Algeria O

. O

PARIS O
1996-08-28 O

Algeria O
, O
fighting O
a O

against O

, O
attacked O

on O

for O

to O

in O

. O

The O

, O

to O

on O

8 O
, O

in O

countries O
like O
Egypt O
which O
is O
also O
fighting O

. O

British O

have O

because O

said O

Hamas O

" O

. O

" O

Wall O
Street O
ponders O

's O

wins O
. O

Donna B-PERSON
Sells E-PERSON

NEW O
YORK O

The O
outcome O

elections O

on O

Street O
this O

might O

as O

Clinton S-PERSON

. O

Concern O

markets O
since O

them O
in O
the O

of O
the O

. O

SOCCER O
- O
UNCAPPED O
PLAYERS O

TO O
FACE O
MACEDONIA O
. O

BUCHAREST O
1996-12-06 O

Romania O

Anghel B-PERSON
Iordanescu E-PERSON
called O
up O
three O

Friday O
in O

next O

a O

Cup O
qualifier O
. O

Midfielder O
Valentin B-PERSON
Stefan E-PERSON
and O
striker O
Viorel B-PERSON
Ion E-PERSON
of O
Otelul O
Galati O
and O

Liviu B-PERSON
Ciobotariu E-PERSON
of O
National O
Bucharest O
are O
the O
newcomers O
for O
the O

eight O
clash O
in O

14 O
. O

Iordanescu S-PERSON
said O
he O
had O
picked O
them O
because O
of O
their O

in O
the O
domestic O
championship O
in O
which O
National O
Bucharest O
are O
top O
and O
Otelul O
Galati O
third O
. O
" O

I O
think O

's O

to O

them O
a O
chance O
, O
" O
he O
told O

CRICKET O
- O
LARA S-PERSON
ENDURES O
ANOTHER O
MISERABLE O
DAY O
. O

Robert B-PERSON
Galvin E-PERSON

MELBOURNE O
1996-12-06 O

Australia O
gave O
Brian B-PERSON
Lara E-PERSON
another O
reason O
to O
be O
miserable O
when O
they O
beat O
West O
Indies O
by O
five O
wickets O
in O
the O
opening O
World O
Series O
limited O
overs O
match O
on O
Friday O
. O

Lara S-PERSON
, O
disciplined O
for O
misconduct O
on O
Wednesday O
, O
was O
dismissed O
for O
five O
to O
extend O
a O
disappointing O
run O
of O
form O
on O
tour O
. O

Australia O
, O
who O
hold O
a O
2-0 O
lead O
in O
the O
five-match O
test O
series O
, O
overhauled O
West O
Indies O
' O
total O
of O
172 O
all O
out O
with O
eight O
balls O
to O
spare O
to O
end O
a O
run O
of O
six O
successive O
one-day O
defeats O
. O

All-rounder O
Greg B-PERSON
Blewett E-PERSON
steered O
his O
side O
to O
a O
comfortable O
victory O
with O
an O
unbeaten O
57 O
in O
90 O
balls O
to O
the O
delight O
of O
the O
42,442 O
crowd O
. O

Man-of-the O
match O
Blewett S-PERSON
came O
to O
the O
wicket O
with O
the O
total O
on O
70 O
for O
two O
and O
hit O
three O
fours O
during O
an O
untroubled O
innings O
lasting O
129 O
minutes O
. O

His O
crucial O
fifth-wicket O
partnership O
with O
fellow O
all-rounder O
Stuart B-PERSON
Law E-PERSON
, O
who O
scored O
21 O
, O
added O
71 O
off O
85 O
balls O
. O

Lara S-PERSON
looked O
out O
of O
touch O
during O
his O
brief O
stay O
at O
the O
crease O
before O
chipping O
a O
simple O
catch O
to O
Shane B-PERSON
Warne E-PERSON
at O
mid-wicket O
. O

West O
Indies O
tour O
manager O
Clive B-PERSON
Lloyd E-PERSON
has O
apologised O
for O
Lara S-PERSON
's O
behaviour O
on O
Tuesday O
. O

He O
( O
Lara S-PERSON
) O
had O
told O
Australia O
coach O
Geoff B-PERSON
Marsh E-PERSON

Ian B-PERSON
Healy E-PERSON
was O
unwelcome O
in O
the O
visitors O
' O

. O

were O
clearly O
angered O

the O

, O

the O

as O

to O

. O

. O

CRICKET O
- O
LARA S-PERSON

MORE O
AUSTRALIAN O

. O

MELBOURNE O
1996-12-06 O

West O
Indies O
batsman O
Brian B-PERSON
Lara E-PERSON
suffered O
another O
blow O
to O
his O
Australian O
tour O
, O
after O
already O
being O
disciplined O
for O
misconduct O
, O
when O
he O
was O
dismissed O
cheaply O
in O
the O
first O
limited O
overs O
match O
against O
Australia O
on O
Friday O
. O

Lara S-PERSON
, O
who O
earned O
a O
stern O
rebuke O
from O
his O
own O
tour O
management O
after O
an O
angry O
outburst O
against O
Australia O
wicketkeeper O
Ian B-PERSON
Healy E-PERSON
, O
scored O
five O
to O
prolong O
a O
run O
of O
poor O
form O
with O
the O
bat O
. O

The O
West O
Indies O
vice-captain O
struggled O
for O
timing O
during O
his O
36-minute O
stay O
at O
the O
crease O
before O
chipping O
a O
ball O
from O
medium O
pacer O
Tom B-PERSON
Moody E-PERSON
straight O
to O
Shane B-PERSON
Warne E-PERSON
at O
mid-wicket O
. O

West O
Indies O
were O
53 O
for O
two O
in O
15 O
overs O
when O
rain O
stopped O
play O
at O
the O
Melbourne O
Cricket O
Ground O
after O
captain O
Courtney B-PERSON
Walsh E-PERSON
won O
the O
toss O
and O
elected O
to O
bat O
. O

Lara S-PERSON
's O
outburst O
three O
days O
ago O
has O
clearly O
turned O
some O
of O
the O
Australian O
public O
against O
him O
. O

As O
he O
walked O
to O
the O
wicket O

was O
greeted O
by O
loud O

from O
sections O
of O
the O
crowd O
. O

On O

innings O
, O

together O
in O
a O

of O

against O
him O
. O

Clive B-PERSON
Lloyd E-PERSON

for O
Lara S-PERSON
's O

Australia O

in O
the O

to O

against O
his O

in O

on O
Tuesday O
. O

Lloyd S-PERSON
did O
not O
say O
what O
form O
the O
discipline O
would O

. O

, O

holds O
the O

for O

. O

by O
124 O

. O

yet O
to O

a O

1996-12-06 O

of O

. O

rushed O
for O
101 O

and O

and O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- -X- -X- O

NCAA O
AMERICAN O
FOOTBALL-OHIO O
STATE O
'S O
PACE S-PERSON
FIRST O
REPEAT O
LOMBARDI O
AWARD O
WINNER O
. O

HOUSTON O
1996-12-05 O

Ohio O
State O
left O
tackle O
Orlando B-PERSON
Pace E-PERSON
became O
the O
first O
repeat O
winner O
of O
the O
Lombardi O
Award O
Thursday O
night O
when O
the O
Rotary O
Club O
of O
Houston O
again O
honoured O
him O
as O
college O
football O
's O
lineman O
of O
the O
year O
. O

Pace S-PERSON
, O
a O
junior O
, O
helped O
Ohio O
State O
to O
a O
10-1 O
record O
and O
a O
berth O
in O
the O
Rose O
Bowl O
against O
Arizona O
State O
. O

He O
was O
the O
most O
dominant O
offensive O
lineman O
in O
the O
country O
and O
also O
played O
defensive O
line O
in O
goal-line O
situations O
. O

Last O
year O
, O
Pace S-PERSON
became O
the O
first O
sophomore O
to O
win O
the O
award O
since O
its O
inception O
in O
1970 O
. O

Pace S-PERSON
outdistanced O
three O
senior O
finalists O
-- O
Virginia O
Tech O
defensive O
end O
Cornell B-PERSON
Brown E-PERSON
, O
Arizona O
State O
offensive O
tackle O
Juan B-PERSON
Roque E-PERSON
and O
defensive O
end O
Jared B-PERSON
Tomich E-PERSON
of O
Nebraska O
. O

The O
Lombardi O
Award O
is O
presented O
to O
the O
college O
lineman O
who O
, O
in O
addition O
to O

SHOWCASE-FANS O

, O

SAYS O
. O

MADRID O
1996-12-06 O

at O

of O

in O

Tickets O

game O

GUNMEN O
KILL O
FOUR O
IN O
S.AFRICA O
'S O
ZULU O
PROVINCE O
. O

DURBAN S-PERSON
, O
South O
Africa O
1996-12-06 O

At O
least O
four O
people O
have O
been O
shot O
dead O
in O
two O
suspected O
political O
attacks O
in O
South O
Africa O
's O
volatile O
Zulu O
heartland O
, O
police O
said O
on O
Friday O
. O

A O
police O
spokesman O
said O
two O
youths O
believed O
to O
be O
supporters O
of O
President O
Nelson B-PERSON
Mandela E-PERSON
's O
African O
National O
Congress O
( O
ANC O
) O
had O
been O
killed O
when O
unknown O
gunmen O
opened O
fire O
at O
the O
rural O
settlement O
of O
Izingolweni O
on O
KwaZulu-Natal O
province O
's O
south O
coast O
on O
Thursday O
night O
. O

The O
victims O
were O
18 O
and O
20 O
, O
he O
said O
, O
adding O
one O
other O
youth O
had O
been O
wounded O
in O
the O
shooting O
. O

In O
another O
attack O
, O
also O
on O
the O
province O
's O
south O
coast O
on O
Thursday O
night O
, O
two O
men O
were O
shot O
dead O
near O
Umkomaas O
. O

" O
We O
suspect O
that O
these O
killings O
are O
linked O
to O
politics O
, O
" O
spokesman O
Bala B-PERSON
Naidoo E-PERSON
told O
Reuters O
. O

There O
had O
been O
no O
arrests O
. O

The O
killings O
came O
just O
hours O
after O
violence O
monitors O
said O
they O
were O
not O
optimistic O
of O
a O
peaceful O
festive O
season O
in O
KwaZulu-Natal O
and O
pointed O
the O
south O
coast O
region O
where O
18 O
people O
were O
massacred O
last O
Christmas O
as O
one O
of O
potential O
hot O
spots O
. O

They O
said O
the O
recent O
lull O
in O
political O
feuding O
could O
be O
upset O
as O
thousands O
of O
migrant O
workers O
, O
some O
tense O
with O
grudges O
brewed O
in O
the O
cities O
and O
keen O
to O
settle O
old O
scores O
, O
flock O
back O
to O

INTERVIEW-ZYWIEC O
SEES O
NO O
BIG O
97 O
NET O
RISE O
. O

Steven B-PERSON
Silber E-PERSON

WARSAW O
1996-12-06 O

Polish O
brewer O
Zywiec O
's O
1996 O
profit O
slump O
may O
last O
into O
next O
year O
due O
in O
part O
to O
hefty O
depreciation O
charges O
, O
but O
recent O
high O
investment O
should O
help O
the O
firm O
defend O
its O
10-percent O
market O
share O
, O
the O
firm O
's O
chief O
executive O
said O
. O

Company O
President O
Jean B-PERSON
van I-PERSON
Boxmeer E-PERSON
told O

in O

on O

that O
the O
firm O
, O
whose O
net O
profit O
fell O
77 O

in O

10 O
months O
of O

despite O
a O

rise O
in O
sales O
, O
might O
only O
post O

better O
profits O
in O
1997 O
before O
having O
a O

to O
make O
a O
more O
significant O
turnaround O
. O

So O
far O
this O
year O

, O
whose O

is O
Zaklady O
Piwowarskie O
w O

224 O
million O

. O

It O
has O
produced O
1.5 O
million O

. O

Van B-PERSON
Boxmeer E-PERSON
would O
not O
say O
how O
much O
higher O
1997 O
profits O
or O
market O

could O
be O
but O
said O

of O

that O

, O
" O

said O

. O

make O

, O

's O

as O

Wall O
St O
speculates O
about O
Santa O
Fe O
savior O
. O

Brendan B-PERSON
Intindola E-PERSON

NEW O

1996-12-06 O

Mining O
Co O
tops O

Street O
's O
list O
as O
the O
most O
likely O
white O

for O

Fe O
Pacific O

Corp O
if O

suitor O
Newmont O
Mining O
Corp O
. O

Santa O
Fe O
is O
so O
far O
mum O
on O

more O
than O
$ O
2 O
billion O

from O

, O

Thursday O
. O

Wall O
Street O
, O

, O
has O

that O

between O

" O

, O
" O

where O

is O

. O

said O
the O

have O
had O
previous O

, O
though O
declined O
to O
detail O
the O
encounters O
. O

predict O

will O

to O
the O

, O
and O
that O

a O

. O

, O

includes O
desirable O
Nevada O

, O
would O
only O
payoff O

. O

, O

will O
not O

from O

Fe O
acquisition O
on O

. O

0.30 O

. O

" O

, O

Plastic O
surgery O
gets O
boost O
in O
Brazil O
. O

Simona B-PERSON
de I-PERSON
Logu E-PERSON

RIO O
DE O
JANEIRO O
1996-12-06 O

Plastic O
surgery O
is O
booming O
, O
especially O
among O
men O
, O
as O
Brazilians O
spend O
much O
of O
their O
new-found O
wealth O
on O
the O
latest O
beauty O
treatments O
, O
said O
the O
organisers O
of O
a O
four-day O
international O
plastic O
surgery O
conference O
that O
opened O
on O
Friday O
. O

The O
number O
of O
plastic O
surgeries O
in O
Brazil O
has O
jumped O
30 O
percent O
to O
an O
estimated O
150,000 O
this O
year O
since O
an O
anti-inflation O
plan O
was O
introduced O
in O
July O
1994 O
, O
Farid B-PERSON
Hakme E-PERSON
, O
the O
president O
of O
the O
Brazilian O
Plastic O
Surgery O
Society O
( O
SBCP O
) O
, O
said O
. O

The O
number O
of O
operations O
on O
men O
increased O
even O
more O
-- O
by O
80 O
percent O
, O
from O
8,000 O
in O
1994 O
to O
15,000 O
in O
1995 O
, O
he O
said O
. O

" O
Brazil O
ranks O
right O
at O
the O
top O
for O
plastic O
surgery O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
number O
of O
surgeons O
, O
the O
number O
of O
patients O
, O
number O
of O
operations O
, O
number O
of O
conferences O
. O

Our O
statistics O
are O
the O
highest O
for O
everything O
, O
" O
Hakme S-PERSON
said O
. O

" O
We O
believe O
the O
increase O
in O
plastic O
surgeries O
for O
men O
results O
from O
the O
difficulties O
in O
the O
job O
market O
. O

People O
need O
to O
have O
a O
more O
youthful O
look O
to O
compete O
in O
the O
job O
market O
, O
given O
the O
profound O
changes O
in O
Latin O
America O
's O
economy O
. O
" O

A O
controlled O
exchange O
rate O
, O
trade O
liberalisation O
and O
tight O
monetary O
policies O
have O
also O
dramatically O
curbed O
inflation O
, O
making O
more O
money O
available O
for O
cosmetic O
surgery O
. O

Brazil O
has O
been O
at O
the O
forefront O
in O
plastic O
surgery O
for O
decades O
and O
is O
home O
to O
one O
of O
the O
most O
famous O
surgeons O
, O
Ivo B-PERSON
Pitangy E-PERSON
. O

There O
are O
6,000 O
plastic O
surgeons O
there O
, O
of O
which O
4,500 O
have O
qualified O
to O
be O
members O
of O
the O
SBCP O
. O

Every O
year O
, O
500 O
new O
plastic O
surgeons O
graduate O
in O
Brazil O
and O
medical O
students O
from O
all O
over O
the O
world O
come O
to O
study O
there O
. O

Hakme S-PERSON
attributes O
Brazil O
's O
fascination O
with O
plastic O
surgery O
not O
to O
excessive O
vanity O
but O
to O
the O
country O
's O
mix O
and O
match O
of O
different O
races O
, O
which O
can O
create O
physical O
disharmonies O
. O
" O

What O
happens O
is O
the O
nose O
sometimes O
does O
n't O
match O
the O
mouth O
or O
the O
buttocks O
do O
n't O
match O
with O
the O
legs O
, O
" O
he O
said O
. O

Brazil O
's O
most O
sought-after O
beauty O
treatment O
is O
liposuction O
in O
which O
fat O
is O
sucked O
away O
from O
areas O
of O
the O
body O
, O
with O
about O
30,000 O
operations O
a O
year O

3,000 O
to O

each O

Stomach O

are O
also O

per O

) O

- O

: O

, O

SINGAPORE O
1996-12-06 O

Indian O

is O

local O

in O

1996/97 O
April O
/ O

season O

persist O

into O

next O
century O
, O

of O

of O

. O

K.J. B-PERSON
Matthew E-PERSON
said O
at O
the O
Asia O

Markets O

here O
Indian O
production O
of O

in O
1996/97 O

tonnes O
against O
projected O

of O
578,000 O
tonnes O
, O
a O

of O
31,000 O
tonnes O
. O

For O

, O

68,200 O

in O

while O

, O

. O

" O

in O

are O

, O

" O

said O
. O

. O

estimates O

. O

up O

in O

against O

. O

. O

, O
head O
of O
the O

( O

) O
, O
of O

. O

, O

. O

. O

, O
41 O

was O
put O
to O

in O

Friday O
. O

As O

, O
a O

at O

( O

) O

his O
second O

and O

Dec. O

. O

" O

" O

Half O
of O
dog O
bites O
provoked O
, O
says O
American O
vet O
. O

CHICAGO O
1996-12-06 O

As O
many O
as O
1 O
million O
dog O
bites O
are O
recorded O
in O
the O
United O
States O
every O
year O
and O
half O
of O
them O
are O
provoked O
by O
humans O
, O
a O
veterinarian O
told O
fellow O
animal O
doctors O
on O
Friday O
. O

The O
Humane O
Society O
of O
the O
United O
States O
estimates O
that O
between O
500,000 O
and O
one O
million O
bites O
are O
delivered O
by O
dogs O
each O
year O
, O
more O
than O
half O
of O
which O
are O
suffered O
by O
children O
. O

" O
Most O
bites O
can O
be O
prevented O
by O
teaching O
children O
how O
to O
respect O
a O
dog O
, O
" O
Michael B-PERSON
Cornwell E-PERSON
of O
the O
Glencoe O
Animal O
Hospital O
in O
Columbus O
, O
Ohio O
, O
told O
the O
annual O
meeting O
of O
the O
American O
Veterinary O
Medical O
Association O
. O

" O
Let O
's O
not O
let O
our O
kids O
jump O
on O
them O
or O
crawl O
on O
them O
. O

Dogs O
and O
children O
do O
n't O
have O
to O
have O
an O
interaction O
. O

Let O
's O
respect O
their O
territories O
, O
" O
he O
said O
. O

Cornwell S-PERSON
said O
50 O
percent O
of O
reported O
bites O
were O
provoked O
by O
a O
person O
and O
60 O
percent O
were O
suffered O
by O
children O
. O

He O
also O
estimated O
that O
only O
25 O
percent O
of O
bites O
were O
reported O
because O
medical O
attention O
was O
not O
needed O
. O

Don B-PERSON
Rieck E-PERSON
, O
president O
of O
the O
National O
Animal O
Control O
Association O
, O
said O
aggressiveness O
in O
dogs O
was O
related O
more O
to O
gender O
than O
breed O
and O
a O
male O
dog O
that O
had O
not O
been O
neutered O
was O
three O
times O
more O
likely O
to O
bite O
than O
an O
unspayed O
female O
. O

The O
five O
breeds O
credited O
with O
the O
most O
incidents O
were O
chow O
chows O
, O
Rottweilers O
, O
German O
shepherds O
, O
cocker O
spaniels O
and O
Dalmatians O
. O
" O

The O
trends O
in O
dog O
bites O
by O
particular O
breeds O
have O
more O
to O
do O
with O
fad O
pets O
owned O
by O
individuals O
who O
need O
to O
have O
something O
unique O
. O

Speaking O
strictly O
of O
dogs O
, O
15 O
years O
ago O
the O
macho O
fad O
pet O
was O
a O
Doberman O
. O

Today O
, O
Rottweilers O
are O
on O
the O
way O
up O
, O
" O
Rieck S-PERSON
said O
. O

If O
approached O
by O
a O
stray O
dog O
, O
children O
should O
be O
taught O
to O
stand O
still O
with O
fists O
folded O
underneath O
the O
neck O
, O
elbows O
in O
, O
and O
gaze O
forward O
until O
the O
dog O
goes O
away O
. O

oil O
import O
tariffs O
. O

BRUSSELS O
1996-12-06 O

The O
European O
Union O
and O
Poland O
have O
resolved O
disagreements O
over O
a O
new O
Polish O
oil O
import O
regime O
, O
the O
European O
Commission O
said O
on O
Friday O
. O

The O
EU O
had O
objected O
to O
increases O
in O
Polish O
tariffs O
on O
imports O
of O
gasoline O
and O
gasoil O
products O
introduced O
on O
January O
1 O
, O
1996 O
, O
saying O
they O
contravened O
levels O
envisaged O
in O
the O
so-called O
Europe O
Agreement O
between O
the O
EU O
and O
Poland O
. O

The O
increases O
were O
aimed O
at O
protecting O
the O
Polish O
market O
while O
helping O
to O
modernise O
the O
local O
oil O
industry O
. O

" O
The O
EU O
and O
Poland O
have O
now O
reached O
a O
final O
settlement O
regarding O
issues O
related O
to O
the O
Polish O
import O
regime O
in O
the O
oils O
sector O
, O
" O
the O
Commission O
said O
in O
a O
statement O
. O

Under O
the O
agreement O
, O
Poland O
will O
abolish O
all O
oil O
import O
tariffs O
by O
2001 O
, O
remove O
all O
oil O
price O
controls O
and O
end O
quantitative O
restrictions O
on O
imports O
by O
January O
1 O
, O
1997 O
. O

The O
agreement O
includes O
the O
early O
privatisation O
and O
modernisation O
of O
Polish O
oil O
refineries O
, O
which O
will O
be O
obliged O
to O
offer O
equal O
treatment O
to O
all O
buyers O
. O

The O
EU O
and O
Poland O
will O
monitor O
the O
settlement O
at O
six-monthly O
meetings O
. O

Hindu O
party O

. O

NEW O

1996-12-06 O

Hindu O
nationalists O
forced O

of O
India O
's O
lower O
house O
of O

on O
Friday O
, O
in O
protest O
against O
a O
proposal O
to O
observe O
a O
minute O
's O
silence O
over O
the O
destruction O
of O
a O
mosque O
by O
a O
Hindu O
mob O
in O
1992 O
. O

Members O
of O
the O
Hindu O
nationalist O
Bharatiya O
Janata O
Party O
( O
BJP O
) O
shouted O
pro-Hindu O
slogans O
in O
the O
house O
after O
a O
communist O
deputy O
made O
the O
proposal O
in O
remembrance O
of O
the O
Babri O
mosque O
, O
which O
was O
razed O
on O
December O
6 O
, O
1992 O
. O

The O
house O
was O
first O
adjourned O
for O
two O
hours O
. O

When O
it O

, O
BJP O
deputies O
resumed O
the O
slogan-shouting O
, O
and O
deputy O
speaker O
Suraj B-PERSON
Bhan E-PERSON
suspended O
work O
until O
Monday O
. O

The O
destruction O
of O
the O
16th-century O
mosque O
in O
the O
northern O
Indian O
town O
of O
Ayodhya O
triggered O
nationwide O
Hindu-Moslem O
violence O
in O
which O
more O
than O
3,000 O
people O
were O
killed O
. O

Indian O
officials O
blame O
revenge-minded O
Moslem O
underworld O
gangs O
in O
Bombay O
for O
a O
string O
of O
bombings O
in O
the O
city O
three O
months O
later O
that O
killed O
260 O
people O
. O

The O
BJP O
backs O
a O
hardline O
Hindu O
campaign O
to O
build O
a O
temple O
at O
the O
site O
of O
the O
mosque O
, O
which O
Hindus O
believe O
was O
the O
birthplace O
of O
the O
Lord O
Rama S-PERSON
. O

The O
campaign O
catapulted O
BJP O
from O
the O
political O
fringe O
to O
become O
India O
's O
main O
opposition O
party O
in O
1991 O
. O

Ramthan B-PERSON
Hussain E-PERSON

SINGAPORE O
1996-12-06 O

Singapore O
's O
winning O
campaign O
to O
host O
the O

Trade O
Organisation O
( O
WTO O
) O
's O
first O

meeting O
reflected O
its O

to O

role O
in O
shaping O

trade O
, O

, O

. O

" O

has O
a O

in O

, O
" O

, O

. O

" O

stands O
to O

as O

of O

, O

. O
" O

The O
city-state O
met O
U.S. O

two O
years O
ago O
in O
its O
bid O
to O
host O
the O

, O
expected O
to O

from O
160 O

from O

9 O
to O

. O

to O

over O

of O
an O
American O

for O

, O

of O

. O

da I-PERSON

( O

. O

" O

Japan O

The O
official O
said O
the O
latest O
government O
decision O
to O
split O
the O
company O
under O
a O
holding O
company O
would O
allow O
flexibility O
in O
NTT O
's O
international O
phone O
business O
. O

Earlier O
, O
Posts O
and O
Telecommunications O
Minister O
Hisao B-PERSON
Horinouchi E-PERSON
told O
a O
news O
conference O
the O
government O
plans O
to O
split O
NTT O
into O
three O
firms O
under O
a O
holding O
company O
, O
but O
did O
not O
specify O
when O
the O
restructuring O
would O
likely O
take O
effect O
. O

One O
of O
the O
three O
new O
companies O
will O
be O
a O
long-distance O
operator O
and O
the O
other O
two O
will O
be O
local-call O
operators O
, O
Horinouchi S-PERSON
said O
. O

One O
of O
the O
local O
firms O
will O
operate O
in O
west O
Japan O
and O
the O
other O
in O
east O
Japan O
, O
he O
added O
. O

The O
long-distance O
operator O
will O
offer O
international O
services O
, O
Horinouchi S-PERSON
said O
. O

The O
NTT O
official O
said O
the O
timing O
of O
the O
planned O
split-up O
was O
uncertain O
because O
more O
discussions O
by O
government O
officials O
were O
required O
. O
